Position Title: Data Services Manager - DBAFLSA Status:  ExemptDepartment Name: Professional Services - MDMReports to: Professional ServicesLocation:  Tampa, FL (required, not remote)Primary Purpose and Function:Syft is a leading provider of Supply Chain Automation and Analytics solutions to US hospitals. Syft has been in business over 21 years, is private equity backed and has a long list of prestigious clients to its credit. Syft has 85 employees based in the Tampa, FL office and a similar number of technical employees in its Hyderabad, India office. Syft is seeking to add a Data Services Manager - DBA supporting its Master Data Management (MDM) Data Services offering.A Data Services Manager - DBA is responsible for project planning, production, delivery and client management activities related to Syft’s MDM Data Services offering.The primary elements of this role include:1. Project Management – Ensure the successful delivery of MDM Data Services projects, on-time and within scope guidelines. Client management is a key element to this role, to manage expectations, lead technical discussions to assist necessary client decision points, and to provide on-going project status updates.2. This is a Technical Role - The Data Services Project Manager is expected to participate in data analysis activities and delivery review prior to client delivery. It is common for the Data Services Project Manager to provide hands-on data analysis and data manipulation support to assist project execution and success.3. MDM Production Coordination – Convey and confirm project technical and schedule requirements with MDM Production Team Leads. Periodically monitor production efforts and production results to ensure compliance with requirements. Identify potential technical or quality gaps early, permitting recovery and process adjustments.4. Risk Management – Recognize technical and schedule risks as early as possible, identify root causes and recommend corrective actions. Early identification permits a coordinated review and response by Syft and/or the Client. Internal or external escalation is expected as needed and as appropriate to the issue.5. Implementation Coordination – MDM Projects delivered in coordination with Syft’s Professional Services Implementation team are common. The Data Services Project Manager will provide necessary project planning guidance, risk identification and coordination with the Syft Program Manager.6. Process Improvement and Automation. The Data Services Project Manager will provide on-going production process improvement guidance and identify production automation opportunities as possible.Essential Functions and Responsibilities:· Direct day-to-day MDM Data Services project management, project planning, delivery and reporting for multiple projects· Client Management, ensuring success, managing expectations and risk· Coordinate MDM production activities and deliveries with Syft’s Professional Services and Implementation Teams· Identify and assist to develop and implement production process improvement and automation strategies· Provide MDM Pre-Sales Support, Presentation, Project Scoping and Proposal PreparationKnowledge, Skills and Experience Needed for the Job:· Familiarity with Hospital Supply chain management analysis, concepts and challenges - required· Extensive project management and client-facing experience - required· Demonstrated understanding of MDM principles and delivery strategies - required· Effective written and verbal communications skills - required· Competent hands-on database skills (i.e., SQL, MSAccess, Visual Basic for Applications, etc.) - preferred· Clinical products & manufacturer domain expertise - preferred· Familiarity or experience with the common Healthcare ERPs - desiredPhysical Demands:· Position will work out of the Syft Tampa, Florida office (required)· Occasional travel to client and prospect sites, usually in the pre-sales phase, as requiredCompany Policy/Procedure Compliance:The Data Services Manager - DBA will be obligated to comply with all company policies and procedures including, but not limited to any Customer Business Associate Agreements that the company may enter into, in addition to complying with other Human Resources requirements. In discharging the duties of this position, the Data Services Manager - DBA may come into contact with confidential patient identifiable electronic health information and will be obligated to maintain the confidentiality of this information and report any breach immediately to the proper hospital authorities.Job Context and Other Relevant Information:The Data Services Manager - DBA has a direct responsibility to ensure the safety of Syft’s brand portfolio. The Data Services Manager - DBA will maintain the highest ethical standards possible in building and protecting brand equity.Compensation and Company BenefitsSyft offers a competitive salary for this position. In addition, we offer a complete employee benefits package including company sponsored major medical and prescription program, dental, vision, life insurance and disability plans. In addition, we offer paid time off (PTO), paid holidays and supplemental insurance programs. We also provide a 401k retirement program with a company match.Equal Opportunity Employment: At Syft we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.Syft is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. KPA exists to help companies keep their workforces safe and healthy. At the end of the day, we succeed if our clients can send their employees home at night, having not experienced the trauma of a workplace accident or an injury.How do we do it? By offering a unique combination of software, consulting, and training that helps clients identify, remedy, and prevent workplace safety and compliance problems so they can focus on what’s important—their core business.Help us help keep people safe and businesses working efficiently. The final vaccine is defined as a second dose for Pfizer or Moderna, or the first dose of Johnson and Johnson.*About KPA*For over 30 years, KPA has helped 10,000+ clients achieve regulatory compliance, maintain a safe workplace, and save money.*Business Nuts and Bolts*Founded in 1986, KPA is a leading provider of Environment, Health & Safety (EHS), and Workforce Compliance software and consulting services. KPA solutions help clients identify, remedy, and prevent workplace safety and compliance problems across their entire enterprise. The combination of KPA's software, consulting services, and award-winning training content helps organizations minimize risk so they can focus on what's important—their core business.KPA’s majority investor is a tier-one private equity firm, Providence Equity Partners, which provides -capital and expertise to accelerate growth organically and through additional acquisitions. We’re now in an exciting time of accelerated growth with the promotion of our SaaS solutions.*Honoring Our Experiences, Building Mutual Respect*At KPA, we strive to build an environment that respects our talented colleagues’ individual experiences and mutual respect for our customers and partners regardless of color, religion, ethnicity, and sexual orientation. Qolo is an enterprise platform technology company that provides next-generation payment solutions and services aimed at helping corporations and people across the world. Our vision is to redefine payments verticals globally and enable our clients to be market leaders in their sectors.
In order to help us realize this vision, we need people who can gather and articulate valuable insights into our business and who engage openly and frequently across our organization. Determination, dedication, and hard work are essential elements to help us along this challenging, but exciting and rewarding, journey.
We hire self-driven professionals who are passionate about delivering quality products and services to our clients, while providing them the opportunity to further their career development. Learn more about us and why we work here at Qolo.
The role:

The Database Architect will work with IT teams: Reporting, Pricing and Analytics, to develop an understanding of data and information needs, identify solutions and improve the quality of service while providing support through the logical and physical design of databases. The position will be responsible for maintaining the integrity and performance of the company databases and guarantee the data is stored securely and efficiently. The position will also provide strategic guidance and implementation of the corporate data warehouse and the corresponding data feeds.
What you’ll do:
Install, design and maintain database system software and implement database security.
Monitor and analyze database performance and ensure effective and efficient utilization of database systems/processes.
 Maintain database dictionaries and support tools; develop and maintain accurate system documentation.
Participate in the development and maintenance of strategic, architectural, and tactical plans for the database and data warehouse environments; be conversant with, and cognizant of, the future direction of systems, how that direction impacts the company and how future and current database systems can be exploited for the company’s benefit.
Provide technical expertise on database systems, tools and solutions. Recommend, test, and evaluate new technologies, software tools, and required skill sets; recommend and implement improvements.
Implement a Business Continuity solution for the database environment, including the installation and configuration of database software and replication processes.
Set and maintain database standards.
Create and mentor Database Administration (DBA) and Management Information System (MIS) teams as determined by management.
Complete other duties as assigned.
What you’ll need:
BS degree in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience.
5+ yrs of SQL server database experience as Database Administrator (DBA), including experience installing, configuring, designing, patching, archiving, and monitoring to include performance tuning databases with indexing.
Experience utilizing various high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) options for MS SQL Server. · Experience with backup/recovery best practices.
Extensive experience with query tuning and troubleshooting.
Working knowledge of data encryption techniques and database querying and management tools.
Experience running and creating SQL Server health assessments reports/SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) report development/experience writing complex SQL Queries. Data warehouse design using star-schema and/or snowflake methodologies.
 Proficient with Microsoft Office Professional.
Bonus points for:
Experience working with start-up organizations
Financial technology and payments processing industry
PowerShell and Power BI development
Microsoft Certifications
Who wouldn’t want to work here!?!
Fully remote
Competitive salary packages
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits (Qolo contributes 75%!)
Self Managed PTO Policy
401(k)

Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

TTI, Inc. is seeking a Database Administrator (DB2). This person is accountable for the performance, maintenance, synchronization, security, and accessibility of all DB2 database systems with demonstrated proficiency in database replication, backup and restore, performance tuning and scalability. The position will require extensive custom DB2 development on the z/OS platform including stored procedures, views and provides technical support to application developers and end users. This position is accountable for troubleshooting system issues; developing and monitoring scheduled jobs and maintenance plans; and for proactively monitoring the performance of databases. Experience developing SQL Code for API use is a plus.
Headquartered in Fort Worth, TX, TTI, Inc. is the world’s leading authorized distributor of passive, connector, electromechanical and discrete components. Just celebrating its 50th anniversary, this Berkshire Hathaway company is ever-growing and has over 100 locations in North America, Europe, and Asia! Join a winning team in a growing global organization!
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Designs, implements and maintains the database architectures enhancing the integrity, security and performance of the database operating environment by collaborating with application developers, server administrators, project management, and end users to accomplish goals and objectives. Provides effective/accurate time estimates based on documented requirements
Develops, tests, and implements extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes from external and internal sources.
Provides effective support on a 24/7 on-call rotation basis by researching & analyzing issues to determine database related implications, effectively communicating with all impacted parties, and troubleshooting & resolving issues with a sense of urgency to minimize any system downtime.
Performs regular full and incremental backups of databases while adhering to the Recovery Time and Recovery Point objectives defined by the business. Periodically verify backups (e.g. by restoring to a test system). Participate in Disaster Recovery drills (i.e. bring databases online at DR site).
Monitors disk space on database and storage servers, CPU and Memory. Identify tuning opportunities for developers and provide tuning advice. Archive data as necessary to keep from using too much disk space.
Provides guidance/support for the Development Team on a regular basis. This includes collaborating with architects and developers to design and implement business processes.
Must prepare database documentation, including standards, procedures, best practices and data dictionary(s).
Must be able to plan, install and test software upgrades and patches where necessary.
Constantly look for opportunities to automate tasks and improve stability/ reliability.
Provides weekly status reports on database state/in-flight projects/maintenance schedules/etc.
Ensures future growth ramifications are considered in all design decisions, forecasting system and storage requirements to accommodate growth in data storage and performance needs. Continuously evaluates the operating performance of the database environment to ensure maximum performance by proactively monitoring the performance of all databases and by developing and implementing changes to enhance overall performance. Performs ongoing planning and monitoring of database size, performance, and hardware capacity.
Continually increases technical knowledge and proactively applies knowledge by keeping abreast of changes in technology via available resources, and utilizes this knowledge by recommending appropriate changes (e.g. programming techniques, software, performance measurement tools, systems and process, etc.).
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma or GED required. A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science plus five years of database development and administration experience; or equivalent combination of education or experience preferred.
SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS
Extensive knowledge & experience of DB2 (version 12 is a plus).
Expert experience in database Backup, Restore and Recovery procedures.
Experience with z/OS Mainframe platform.
Experience in building Stored Procedures.
Work collaboratively with other team members and application groups
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills and multitasking ability.
Show initiative, self-direction, and follow-through on assignments
Embraces and leads technological change and development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively document procedures.
Ability to work weekends and after business hours.
Strong desire and passion to learn new technologies
Demonstrated commitment to quality.
IBM DB2 certification(s) are desirable.
Knowledge of competing database platforms.
Possess accurate keyboarding proficiency.
This is a summary of the primary accountabilities and requirements for this position. The company reserves the right to modify or amend accountabilities and requirements at anytime at its sole discretion based on business needs. 12. Planning, configuring, customizing and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services.

NexGen is currently seeking an Sr Oracle DBA to perform general Oracle DBA tasks. Database Administration duties encompass operations and maintenance of existing corporate data, including coordination, planning, and control to ensure a stable information systems environment. This individual will be required to work closely with members of the NexGen’s and client’s teams, including but not limited to subject matter experts, technical staff, and project managers.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned:

Operate and maintain multiple Oracle database instances.
Configure and Maintain Database Servers on UNIX
Install, Patch, and Upgrade Oracle Software
Create, Maintain, and Upgrade Oracle Databases
Monitor, and Verify Backups and Perform Database Refreshes as Requested
Create and Maintain SQL, PL/SQL and UNIX shell scripts
Data analysis and cleansing including verification and validation of data quality.
Data Extraction, transformation, and loading
Perform routine security and authentication measures
Managing the storage structures of the database
Managing users and security
Managing schema objects, such as tables, indexes, and views
Proactively monitoring the condition of the databases taking preventive or corrective actions, as required

Support Development Project Teams
Respond to customer requests in a timely manner.

Develop/implement plans and schedules for patches, version and release upgrades and migrations.
Ensure continuity of the operational environment and customer satisfaction.

Ability to create physical and logical data models effectively

Oracle Utilities Cloud Database Administrator
Responsibilities:
The Oracle DBA is responsible for providing technical expertise in the analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance of an existing high-volume, data intensive system. Position requires critical thinking and problem-solving abilities to address complex issues involving performance analysis, data migration, information life cycle management, multi tenancy for applications designed for very large databases.
Candidate must be able to support large enterprise initiatives and help resolve architectural issues in the environment and database infrastructure, as well as develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of the database architecture and the application functionality.
Additional responsibilities may include database design and implementation for multiple products; supporting multiple lab environments; installing, maintaining, and refreshing Oracle database for development and test environments; analyzing performance issues and providing recommendation based on testing results; proactively diagnosing and resolving problems affecting database; maintaining database configurations in compliance with release management and change management; participates in special projects and performs additional duties as required.
The candidate will work with a cross-section of organizations, including other DBAs, systems engineers, developers and the management team. The candidate is expected to work on shifts for ensuring 24*7 availability for the SaaS solutions.
The candidate will work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.
 REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong knowledge of Oracle 10g /11g/12c internals, from performance troubleshooting from SQL to ASM.
Strong Database Administration and SQL skills
Operating system knowledge (Unix, Linux and/or Windows)
Daily administration activities such as Datapump Export/Import, Database migration/cloning, RMAN, Data Guard replication, backup/restore, patching, maintenance, upgrades, storage layout and access control should be second nature
Hands on experience with OEM 13c, AWR, ASH, SQL Tuning Advisor, SQL Plan Baselines.
Extensive knowledge of high availability database concepts.
Proficient with automation of maintenance tasks using PL/SQL and scripting tools such as shell script, Perl or Python
Superior troubleshooting skills, battle-tested in high-volume production environments including Grid Control Administration
Hands on experience on RAC, Data Guard and multitenant database
Maintenance and support for VLDB databases
Schema design and access control for multi-tenancy databases.
The following technical skills are plus:
Hands on Experience with Golden Gate
Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)
Hands on experience with VPD, Data Vault, TDE, Audit Vault is a plus
Operations support as well as Cloud operation experience
Additional experience with Oracleâ€™s Exadata engineered systems is preferred
Personal Competencies:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer focus and issue handling skills
Strong analytical reasoning and problem solving skills
Strong focus on diagnosing and resolving complex technical problems
Strong teamwork skills and ability to work as member of a global team
Results oriented
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Work with a world-class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for all products using Oracle Utilities Application Framework and provide DBA services to SaaS development and production environments.
Own database architecture and design for Oracle Utilities Framework products and help resolve complex technical issues.
Provide product development support. This includes creating primary database storage structures, designing and creating primary objects, modifying database structure as necessary for enhancements or performance, creating/maintaining documentation and standards, establishing application development best practices, monitor and optimize performance of the database, plan for backup and recovery of the database, and allocate system storage and plan future storage needs.
Design /develop / maintain database upgrade procedures/tools. This comprises creating/maintaining database-related scripts and programs to upgrade database portion of the Oracle Utility products and the scripts for database support of the development environments.
Research, evaluate, design, test, recommend, and plan implementation of new or improved RDBMS, ETL and database tools.
Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. It requires 10 years of experience supporting relational databases as an Oracle DBA. Exposure and practice at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large production databases for enterprise use is preferred. Raytheon Intelligence and Space is seeking a Sr. Linux System Administrator/Database Administrator to join our team in operating and maintaining the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS), a state-of-the-art ground station for the next generation of low earth orbiting environmental satellites. This system provides global coverage, monitor environmental conditions, collect, disseminate, and process data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.


This position is a combination of Oracle/PostgreSQL database administration and Linux Systems administration in the JPSS environment.

As a System Administrator/Database Administrator the selected candidate will be part of a team responsible for troubleshooting, maintaining, and implementing solutions to optimize the infrastructure operations as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining the Oracle and Postgres relational databases. This work will include installations, upgrades, patching, tuning, systems integration, and systems analysis. Security of the Linux and database environments will be a top priority.


Duties can include, but not limited to:
Installation of database software upgrades, patch releases and system upgrades
Linux Systems Administration
Execution of recurring security maintenance and compliance functions across a widely dispersed ground system
Installation of workstations, installing licenses, and adding VMWare VMs.
Patch and Vulnerability evaluation, remediation, and work-off/closure of security findings
Database benchmarking, data manipulation, SQL and physical storage
Work location may be either Raytheon facility in Riverdale, MD or Aurora, CO. Position will be a combination of on-site (60-70%) and telecommuting

Qualified applicants must be a U.S. Citizen, will be subject to a security investigation, must be able to obtain a DOD Common Access Card (CAC) and pass a national agency check.

Required Skills:
5 years of experience with Linux Systems Administration and Database Administration
1 year minimum experience with Oracle 12 and/or 19
Experience with large VMWare environments
Oracle Support utility skills (PL/SQL, SQL, DataPump/export/import)
Experience with security requirements for databases, developing, documenting, and implementing backup and recovery procedures.
Hardware/software trouble shooting skills.
Scripting Experience (bash, Perl, Python)
Experience with database performance tuning, partitioning, blobs, database storage management, data security and protection, and performing backups/ restores.
Ability to establish and maintain good working relationship with all levels of an organization, including customers, engineering organizations, IPT members, supporting functional organizations.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Desired Skills:
Networking Experience
1 year experience with PostgresSQL
Windows Active Directory Experience
Experience with database modeling and design
AWS RDS database administration

Required Education:
University Degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 5 years of prior relevant experience.
Travel:
Occasional travel in the Continental United States.


Schedule:
Normal work hours are between 8am and 5pm; however, various mission activities will require a flexible work schedule, sometimes off-hours, weekends and possibly holidays depending on mission needs.

Benefits offered: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays.

In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role is $70,000 - $150,000; however, Raytheon Technologies considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education/training, and key skills.

Job Description:
At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Database Administrator, you will be trusted to: plan, develop, secure, monitor, and improve the performance of database systems of high complexity; evaluate and optimize database configurations and access; proactively monitor database performance and capacity and resolve performance or capacity issues; and recommend solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications. You will be part of a team supporting the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).
We are GDIT. The people supporting and securing some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work has meaning and impact on the world around us, but also on us, and that’s important.
GDIT is your place. You make it your own by embracing autonomy, seizing opportunity, and being trusted to deliver your best every day.
We think. We act. We deliver. There is no challenge we can’t turn into opportunity. Our work depends on a Database Administrator joining our team to support CMS activities in Columbia, MD.
In this role, a typical day will include:
Plans, develops, tests, implements, monitors, documents, and improves the performance of database systems of high complexity
Performs complex database evaluations and reviews and optimizes database configurations and access
Proactively monitors database performance and capacity and resolves performance or capacity issues.
Recommends solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications.
Research and fact-finding to develop or modify database structures
Provides support for database implementation and periodic maintenance releases as required
Provides technical input to assist in development of tasks related to Database Administration during sprint planning and backlog refinement sessions
Work with the Data Architecture team to ensure databases are synchronized across the environments
Ability to run advisory analysis and test candidate indexes to support and suggest query performance
Explain plans for application SQL and provide areas of improvement to the development teams. Performs additional responsibilities as requested or assigned
Maintains RDBMS software at appropriate vendor-supported levels
Works closely with Central Database Administration team on various items related to reviews, implementation, standards, compliance, operational support, backup and disaster recovery
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Candidate must be able to obtain Public Trust clearance and must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field or equivalent experience
5 years of DBA experience on IBM Mainframe DB2, preferably V11 and/or V12, automating and facilitating database management
Experience with BMC and IBM DB2 utilities and tools such as SPUFI, JCL, TSO, and FILE AID
Hands on experience coding JCL’s, parameters, load cards for unloads, loads, load dummy etc.
Experience using Endeavor for JCL builds for version control and change management
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
US citizen or a Green Card holder
Health Care Industry or Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) experience
Knowledge of and experience with z/OS operating system, utilities, file system, kernel, memory management & security on RDBMS
Deep knowledge of IBM DB2 LUW and Oracle database administration at the design, operational and system levels
Experience tuning complex database systems at the application, database and system levels
Thorough knowledge of and experience with database security, backup, recovery and archiving
Experience/understanding of Tivoli scheduling tool
Experience working in a collaborative, cross functional team environment
Experience facilitating meetings and peer reviews
Agile experience
AWS certification

40

Less than 10%
Telecommuting Options:
Some Telecommuting Allowed

Job Description:
Job Description
We are GDIT. We stay at the forefront of innovation to solve complex technical challenges.
At GDIT, we foster a people-centric environment. As a Database Administrator supporting one of the most technical DoD Agency’s, you will be trusted to work on National Level Technology. In this role, a typical day will include:
Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of database(s)
Establish and maintain database user accounts
Administer, maintain, and Implement policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Organize and format data for efficient query and storage processes
Evaluate requirements and recommends available DBMS products
Provide server administration with a variety of database products that include Oracle, SQL Server, and SYBASE
Perform disaster recovery, performance analysis and tuning, index maintenance, and monitoring of data
Develop policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of the database(s)
Perform database and software life-cycle activities to ensure highest level of system performance and availability
Support data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations
Coordinate database architecture changes with Database Engineer (DBE)s
Direct the monitoring, administrating, and implementing performance on database systems as well as database performance optimization, developing/changing database indices, redesigning database structure and reloading data into a database
Direct the installation of database management systems, databases, tables and views
Directs the administration and use of current and emerging database tools, strategies, and technologies
WHAT YOU’LL NEED:
Ten (10) years’ experience as a DBA in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required. Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Four (4) years of additional DBA experience may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree.
Two (2) year experience in Oracle database system
IAT Level I Certification, IA Baseline Certification
Security clearance level( An Active TS/SCI and Polygraph)
WHAT GDIT CAN OFFER YOU:
Full-flex work week
401K with company match

Overview
Come join our growing team at Burlington Stores as an Oracle Database Administrator IV! The senior Oracle database administrator (DBA) provides database and application administration support for the Burlington Stores, Inc. corporate office and all stores. T he Senior DBA will install, configure, maintain, and administer MS SQL and Oracle databases and application server software that includes RDBMS, RAC and ASM that run on the Linux platform. Our ideal candidate will be a part of the team to focus on performance, monitor, tune, troubleshoot, secure, provide backup and recovery, capacity planning, change control, and ensure business continuity for these services.
The senior DBA supports technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the group with respect to the database, application servers, and related storage and processing. W ork with the DBA manager and DBA team to ensure the database and application software and configuration adhere to organizational procedures and practices. This position requires the ability to work nights and/or weekends as necessary.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install and configure MS SQL and Oracle software: RDBMS, RAC and ASM. Creates production, test, and development database environments and instances as required
Monitoring Performance and Tune: Proactively Monitor database performance, diagnose performance problems, and tune the database as necessary. Investigate, gather diagnostic data for, and report to Support Services any critical database errors. Configure and manage memory allocation and adjust as needed. Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database
Provide leadership to the DBA team and work alongside management to accomplish business initiatives. Work closely with the Sys Admins and Business Analysts
Backup and recovery: Create a backup strategy, transaction log strategy & management, disaster recovery planning. Create or review the backup strategy for the database test backups with periodic, regular restores. Clones/restore instances with RMAN
Storage: Configure and manage storage, including tablespaces and datafiles, redo log files, and control files. Anticipate storage requirements; create or modify storage structures as needed before files are filled and cause application errors
Security: Configure and manage security, including database auditing
Patching: Keep Database software up-to-date with the latest patch releases
Education & Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5 years' experience as DBA
In lieu of Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of experience working as a Database Administrator, will accept 7+ years of experience in Oracle Database Server Management or combination of education and experience
Expertise with Oracle Enterprise RDBMS 11g, including RAC and ASM
Expertise in MS SQL database and performance
Experience working with Linux or similar enterprise systems
Experience writing SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Skill in both verbal and written communication

Description:
Company Description
San Francisco Public Works has a far-reaching portfolio with a $352 million annual operating budget, an active capital portfolio that exceeds $3 billion and a workforce of 1,600-plus employees. The department operates around the clock, touching every neighborhood in San Francisco. The staff designs and manages construction of civic buildings and streets; cleans and greens the right of way; maintains civic buildings; manages multi-million-dollar bond programs; trains people for jobs; keeps the right of way free of hazards; paves the roads; repairs bridges and public stairways; expands accessibility; and works at the forefront addressing some of San Francisco’s biggest challenges, including homelessness. With a mission to enhance the quality of life in San Francisco for residents, visitors and business owners, Public Works is committed to providing outstanding public service through an equity lens.
Information Technology
Designs, programs, operates and maintains all department-wide automated information systems and equipment. Services include process analysis and planning; software development, configuration and implementation; network and hardware installation; technology operations; help desk and security; and software support and system compliance functions.
1054 IS Business Analyst-Principal Compensation Effective 7/1/21-1/7/22
Hourly: $61.88-$83.83
Biweekly: $4,951-$6,707
Annually: $128,726-$174,382

Job Description
Essential duties include, but are not limited to:
1. Optimize system designs through review and analysis of user needs; customize systems through design and administration.
2. Identify opportunities for improvements in business processes through automation; make recommendations for new procedures and applications.
3. Analyze the feasibility of 'and develop requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems; prepare cost estimates and schedules for modifications; set scope, boundaries and objectives for system' functions and interfaces based on departmental needs.
4. Design, develop and implement new systems to support departmental activities.
5. Define system requirements; design, code, test and debug systems; train users on new applications.
6. Develop or modify system design: write detailed design specifications.
7. Provide advice on the functionality of new programs and compatibility of modifications to ensure user needs are met.
8. Evaluate software and hardware products on multiple platforms; make recommendations for compatibility, based on user requirements and systems analysis.
9. Provide analysis and technical support for highly complex systems; troubleshoot systems problems; implement solutions.
10. Support and maintain highly technical systems or networks; analyze and evaluate systems for cost effective and efficient performance; recommend modifications.
11. Coordinate the efforts of analysts, engineers and operators in the implementation of projects spanning multiple systems and sites; multiple platforms.
12. Manage and monitor the progress of contractors and vendors; resolve problems.

Qualifications
Education:
An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field].
Experience:
 2. Five (5) years of experience in the information systems field, including system analysis, business process design, development and implementation of business application solutions or IT project management.
AND
 3. Special Condition: The below minimum qualifications reflect special conditions associated with the position(s) to be filled. They may differ from the standard minimum qualifications associated with this classification:
Five (5) years of Database Modeling and Design Experience performing key management and thought leadership role in the areas of: data techniques, including data modeling, data access, data integration, data visualization, database design and implementation; AND
Five (5) years of SQL server database applications experience designing relational SQL database structures and processes in at least one of the following environments: Oracle or Microsoft Server.
License and Certification:

Substitution:
Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field.
Notes:
1.One-year full-time employment is considered equivalent to 2000 hours (2000 hours of qualifying work experience is based on a 40 hour work week). Any overtime hours that you work above forty (40) hours per week are not included in the calculation to determine full-time employment.
2. Applicants must meet the minimum qualification requirement by the final filing date unless otherwise noted.

Applicants are strongly encouraged to fill out each portion of the employment application. Any experience or education field that lists "see resume" will not be accepted.

Additional Information
SELECTION PROCEDURE:

Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire (MQSQ): Candidates will be required to submit an MQSQ at any point in the application, examination or departmental selection process. This MQSQ is designed to obtain specific information regarding an applicant's experience in relation to the Minimum Qualifications for this position. Applicants must also complete the Preliminary Questions. It is essential that applicants provide complete information in identifying their education, experience and training. The Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire will be used to evaluate if the applicant possesses the required minimum qualifications.
Supplemental Questionnaire Examination (Weight: 100%): Candidates deemed qualified will be invited to participate in a Supplemental Questionnaire examination designed to measure their relative knowledge, skill and ability levels in job-related areas which may include, but are not limited to the following:
Knowledge of: Requirements, installation procedures, hardware, software and maintenance of systems; practices and techniques of supervision and of project management; training techniques; interactive and macro-based applications; functional requirements, structured systems or procedures analysis; systems analysis and design; coding, testing and implementing complex programs; script/procedure languages; common operating systems software and relational database systems; data modeling; electronic data processing methods; network management and coordination; project cost estimating; contracts negotiation and management; long range planning techniques; practices and techniques of project management; systems development life cycle; business applications development; and technical writing.
Ability and Skill to: Manage and direct a group of workers, including the ability to provide counseling and mediation; persuade, convince and train others; communicate effectively both orally and in writing; communicate clear expectations to subordinates and motivate them to perform effectively; establish and maintain good working relations with department personnel, staff, vendors, peers and management; understand and learn a variety of business procedures and processes; exercise the judgement, decisiveness and creativity required in situations involving the direction, control and planning of a program or multiple programs; use logic and analysis to solve computer and systems problems; translate functional requirements into systems specifications; decide the time, place and sequence of operations within an organizational framework, as well as the ability to oversee their execution; read and understand professional journals and literature; coordinate highly technical procedures and complex reporting requirements; prioritize competing requests for service; develop network design; conduct cost/benefit analyses; prepare technical specifications; produce complex reports, coordinate highly technical procedures and complex reporting requirements; develop new approaches and solutions outside of existing theories and principles, and engage in high level consulting.
Qualified candidates will be notified of the date, time, and exam format in their exam invitation.

An examination score report will be established, so applicants can view the ranks, final scores and number of eligible candidates. Applicant information, including names of applicants on the eligible list, shall not be made public unless required by law. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.

LOCATION 4287 Route 130 S Edgewater Park NJ US 08010
Overview
Come join our growing team at Burlington Stores as an Oracle Database Administrator IV! The senior Oracle database administrator (DBA) provides database and application administration support for the Burlington Stores, Inc. corporate office and all stores. T he Senior DBA will install, configure, maintain, and administer MS SQL and Oracle databases and application server software that includes RDBMS, RAC and ASM that run on the Linux platform. Our ideal candidate will be a part of the team to focus on performance, monitor, tune, troubleshoot, secure, provide backup and recovery, capacity planning, change control, and ensure business continuity for these services.
The senior DBA supports technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the group with respect to the database, application servers, and related storage and processing. W ork with the DBA manager and DBA team to ensure the database and application software and configuration adhere to organizational procedures and practices. This position requires the ability to work nights and/or weekends as necessary.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install and configure MS SQL and Oracle software: RDBMS, RAC and ASM. Creates production, test, and development database environments and instances as required
Monitoring Performance and Tune: Proactively Monitor database performance, diagnose performance problems, and tune the database as necessary. Investigate, gather diagnostic data for, and report to Support Services any critical database errors. Configure and manage memory allocation and adjust as needed. Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database
Provide leadership to the DBA team and work alongside management to accomplish business initiatives. Work closely with the Sys Admins and Business Analysts
Backup and recovery: Create a backup strategy, transaction log strategy & management, disaster recovery planning. Create or review the backup strategy for the database test backups with periodic, regular restores. Clones/restore instances with RMAN
Storage: Configure and manage storage, including tablespaces and datafiles, redo log files, and control files. Anticipate storage requirements; create or modify storage structures as needed before files are filled and cause application errors
Security: Configure and manage security, including database auditing
Patching: Keep Database software up-to-date with the latest patch releases
Education & Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5 years' experience as DBA
In lieu of Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of experience working as a Database Administrator, will accept 7+ years of experience in Oracle Database Server Management or combination of education and experience
Expertise with Oracle Enterprise RDBMS 11g, including RAC and ASM
Expertise in MS SQL database and performance
Experience working with Linux or similar enterprise systems
Experience writing SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Skill in both verbal and written communication

As the Entry Level Database Specialist, you will be converting customer data from competitive databases to Reynolds databases. You will also complete migration of customer data from one Reynolds hardware platform to another. Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, or related field; open to entry-level candidates
Knowledge of C and MS SQL Server preferred
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Ability to establish goals, set priorities and multi-task is a must
Good communication skills
Must have a flexible work schedule with ability to periodically work evenings or weekends

Lucid Motors is searching for a SQL Database Administrator for its Casa Grande area facilities. The Database Administrator will be responsible for monitoring, assessing the functionality, improvements and maintaining all SQL databases in the plant. The SQL Database Administrator will be the primary point of contact for SQL database related issues, interfaces to MES/SAP and will be responsible to ensure business continuity in the plant.
The Role
The SQL Administrator will be responsible for the integration, operation and maintenance of all SQL databases in the plant
Ensure the integrity and performance of databases
Monitor and maintain interfaces to MES/SAP
Guarantee that data is stored securely and optimally
Inform end users of changes in databases and train them to utilize systems
Ensure the security of company data
Lead project activities and service availability
Work on establishing consistent metrics for continuous improvement
Assist with defining the objectives of improvements, including developing and reviewing proposals and presentations
Review, develop, and support the implementation of modifications to meet future needs
Project Management
Qualifications
BS/MS in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent work experience
A minimum of 5+ years of experience in SQL Databases
Proven experience in SAP and MES Systems
Familiarity with database queries
Knowledge of database design and theories
Experience with server installation and maintenance
Familiarity with database management best practices
Knowledge of IT security best practices
Expert knowledge of computer programming (OPC, HTML, JAVA, Phyton, C Sharp, Visual Basic)
Problem solving skills specific to Information Technology, Network Management and System Design
Experienced in designing and implementing Business Continuity Plans and Disaster Recovery Plans
Strong analytical skills for interpreting business requirements and translating them into technical specifications
Project management experience
Manufacturing automotive experience

This GIS Database Administrator is a contract position to support Tetra Tech’s delivery of the Geoframe GIS Portal in Puerto Rico. The position is based in Puerto Rico.
Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.
At Tetra Tech, health and safety play a vital role in our success. Tetra Tech’s employees work together to comply with all applicable health & safety practices and protocols, including health orders and regulations related to COVID-19 that are mandated by local, state and federal authorities.
Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.

Your Role :
Responsible for the day to day spatial and tabular data maintenance within the ESRI Enterprise/SQL Server geodatabase.
Will oversee the data model design, approve design changes, establish topology criteria, define relationship classes, domains, and subtypes within an ESRI Enterprise geodatabase.
Will manage versions, spatial indices, and generation of statistics.
Will tune the enterprise geodatabase to work with ESRI Web mapping applications.
The DBA will work with end users (both GIS personnel and website users) to implement data standards and quality assurance standards by creating and updating the data dictionary and automated data validation processes.
Will document methodologies used in the management of databases and reporting.
Will work closely with the Enterprise (ArcSDE) Geodatabase Administrator to keep databases performing efficiently.

Qualifications :
Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, geography, engineering, planning and development, science or GIS related field from four-year college or university;
minimum of three (3) years’ experience in ESRI ArcGIS Server, ArcGIS Enterprise/Portal, and ArcGIS Desktop/ArcGIS Pro applications;
Experience managing ESRI Enterprise geodatabase using SQL Server; Enterprise experience including: registering and maintaining databases using ESRI and SQL Server (Oracle, MSSQL or other major related database management systems), working with spatial data types, managing feature classes, managing relationship classes, structuring queries and spatial views, spatial analysis methods and geoprocessing tools.
Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio.
About Tetra Tech:

Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 400 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees—21,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

We invite resumes from all interested parties. Please visit our website at www.tetratech.com to see the array of diverse services and exciting projects we are currently working on.

Overview: FTI is a trusted source for using innovation to deliver informed, productive, & secure solutions within the federal government sector. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst for a key initiative for the Ready, Relevant Learning (RRL) program in Norfolk, VA. The candidate must be willing to relocate to the Norfolk, VA or local surronding area. The individual will provide significant support to the RRL program managers and team members.Responsibilities:Assist the RRL Program team to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of RRL processes and the training delivered using RRL strategies.Support the collection, processing and integration of data from multiple disparate, automated and manual sources. The Data Analyst will design and execute processes to access data, write queries, create and run reports, manipulate and parse potentially large datasets to support analysis.The Data Analyst will develop and administer procedures to ensure integrity, accuracy, appropriateness, and completeness of RRL assessment data.Lead the development of individual training metrics to assess impact to sailor performance and Fleet readiness as well as develop and maintain interactive visualizations, such as dashboards, to support analysis and to present meaningful performance metrics to senior leadership.This position will also support the monitoring of RRL performance measures, identification of trends, as well as provide inputs to RRL program management risk assessments.Support of the development, modification and validation of new and existing performance measures for Sailor performance, program performance, and readiness impacts, as well as assisting in the development of RRL assessments data collection processes and requirements.Provide inputs for and assist in drafting period analytical reports and perform ad-hoc data analysis, as required, to address emergent tasking.This position will design, build and maintain RRL assessment database using MS Access database or similar database tool.Education/Qualifications:Education – Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Data Analysis, Statistics, or Operational ResearchSkills / tools / programming competency / technical background – Microsoft Access, SQL, statistics, data analysis, research, strong communications skills, decisive, focused, responsive in planning and completing tasksExperience: Two or more years performing similar tasks as mentioned above. Experience supporting U.S. Navy/DOD clients highly desiredMust have active security clearanceJob Type: Full-time

LOCATION 4287 Route 130 S Edgewater Park NJ US 08010
Overview
Come join our growing team at Burlington Stores as an Oracle Database Administrator IV! The senior Oracle database administrator (DBA) provides database and application administration support for the Burlington Stores, Inc. corporate office and all stores. T he Senior DBA will install, configure, maintain, and administer MS SQL and Oracle databases and application server software that includes RDBMS, RAC and ASM that run on the Linux platform. Our ideal candidate will be a part of the team to focus on performance, monitor, tune, troubleshoot, secure, provide backup and recovery, capacity planning, change control, and ensure business continuity for these services.
The senior DBA supports technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the group with respect to the database, application servers, and related storage and processing. W ork with the DBA manager and DBA team to ensure the database and application software and configuration adhere to organizational procedures and practices. This position requires the ability to work nights and/or weekends as necessary.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install and configure MS SQL and Oracle software: RDBMS, RAC and ASM. Creates production, test, and development database environments and instances as required
Monitoring Performance and Tune: Proactively Monitor database performance, diagnose performance problems, and tune the database as necessary. Investigate, gather diagnostic data for, and report to Support Services any critical database errors. Configure and manage memory allocation and adjust as needed. Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database
Provide leadership to the DBA team and work alongside management to accomplish business initiatives. Work closely with the Sys Admins and Business Analysts
Backup and recovery: Create a backup strategy, transaction log strategy & management, disaster recovery planning. Create or review the backup strategy for the database test backups with periodic, regular restores. Clones/restore instances with RMAN
Storage: Configure and manage storage, including tablespaces and datafiles, redo log files, and control files. Anticipate storage requirements; create or modify storage structures as needed before files are filled and cause application errors
Security: Configure and manage security, including database auditing
Patching: Keep Database software up-to-date with the latest patch releases
Education & Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5 years' experience as DBA
In lieu of Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of experience working as a Database Administrator, will accept 7+ years of experience in Oracle Database Server Management or combination of education and experience
Expertise with Oracle Enterprise RDBMS 11g, including RAC and ASM
Expertise in MS SQL database and performance
Experience working with Linux or similar enterprise systems
Experience writing SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Skill in both verbal and written communication

…take a sense of pride and ownership in helping drive positive results for a team;
…are committed to treating colleagues and customers with respect;
…believe in the power of diversity and inclusion;
…want to participate in initiatives that positively impact the world around you;
Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!
You will enjoy a competitive wage and comprehensive benefit package including a generous paid time off plan, a company matched 401(k) and an associate discount. We are a rapidly growing brand and provide a variety of professional development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. We work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

JOB SUMMARY

Children's Healthcare of Atlanta is hiring a Senior Database Admin to join our permanent team! The Senior Database Admin provides enterprise-wide, DBA support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, operations, and data warehouse development teams - including database design, database creation, and database production support. This role is responsible for the smooth operation of the databases that use the customer and internal facing application, information delivery, and data warehouse development teams.

EDUCATION
A bachelor's degree in computer science or above or six to eight years of equivalent experience
CERTIFICATION SUMMARY
No professional certifications required
EXPERIENCE*
Five or more years of experience performing database administration functions and supporting databases in a production environment
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS*
Microsoft SQL Server DBA Certification or Oracle OCP (depending upon the role)
KNOWLEDGE SKILLS & ABILITIES*
Thorough knowledge of and demonstrated competency with techniques of data modeling resulting in an Entity Relationship Diagram deliverable
Demonstrate well-developed organizational, written communication, and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills to interact positively and productively with teams across organizational lines, including administrative, executive staff and patient care systems users
Must be able to function in a dynamic environment subject to impromptu changes in schedules and priorities
Demonstrates and applies knowledge of data warehousing architectural approaches (including virtual data warehousing)
Demonstrates data modeling skills (Normalization, Star Schema, “The Vault”) skills
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES*
Is instrumental in researching, evaluating, designing, testing, recommending, and planning implementation of new versions of database and database tools.
Provides DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness.
Provides coaching and guidance to application programmers, analysts, and data analysts. Assist with the setup and installation database structures or objects.
Works closely with the application developers, information delivery/data warehouse developers, and Operations to ensure reliable database usage.
Participates in design walkthroughs and joint application development sessions.
Creates, documents, and enforces policies, procedures, and standards related to database administration and management.
Provides development and production support to troubleshoot day-to-day database or related application issues.
Monitors database server capacity/performance, and makes infrastructure and architecture recommendations to management for necessary changes/updates.
Provides Master and Metadata management capabilities.
SYSTEM RESPONSIBILITIES*

Safety: Practices proper safety techniques in accordance with hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Responsible for the reporting of employee/patient/visitor injuries or accidents, or other safety issues to the supervisor and in the occurrence notification system.

Compliance: Monitors and ensures compliance with all regulatory requirements, organizational standards, and policies and procedures related to area of responsibility. Identifies potential risk areas within area of responsibility and supports problem resolution process. Maintains records of compliance activities and reports compliance activities to the Compliance Office.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS*
Ability to lift up to 15 lbs independently not to exceed 50 lbs without assistance
Bending/Stooping - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Climbing - Not Present
Hearing/Speaking - Effective communication with employees, supervisors/managers and staff. Effective communications with patients and visitors, as required.
Lifting - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Pushing/Pulling - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Sitting - Frequently (activity or condition exists from 1/3 to 2/3 of time)
Standing - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
Walking - Occasionally (activity or condition exists up to 1/3 of time)
WORKING CONDITIONS*
No potential for exposure to blood and body fluids

About Us:
Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta has been 100 percent committed to kids for more than 100 years. A not-for-profit organization, Children’s is dedicated to making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
With 3 hospitals, 20 neighborhood locations and a total of 673 beds, Children’s is the largest healthcare provider for children in Georgia and one of the largest pediatric clinical care providers in the country. Children’s offers access to more than 60 pediatric specialties and programs and is ranked among the top children’s hospitals in the country by U.S. News & World Report.
Children’s has been recognized as a Fortune 100 Best Place to Work, a Best Place for Working Mothers, and as a top employer for diversity and millennials. We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefit package that supports our mission, vision and values. We are proud to offer an array of programs and services to our employees that have distinguished us as a best place to work in the country. Connect to our mission of making kids better today and healthier tomorrow.
