LOCATION 4287 Route 130 S Edgewater Park NJ US 08010
Overview
Come join our growing team at Burlington Stores as an Oracle Database Administrator IV! The senior Oracle database administrator (DBA) provides database and application administration support for the Burlington Stores, Inc. corporate office and all stores. T he Senior DBA will install, configure, maintain, and administer MS SQL and Oracle databases and application server software that includes RDBMS, RAC and ASM that run on the Linux platform. Our ideal candidate will be a part of the team to focus on performance, monitor, tune, troubleshoot, secure, provide backup and recovery, capacity planning, change control, and ensure business continuity for these services.
The senior DBA supports technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the group with respect to the database, application servers, and related storage and processing. W ork with the DBA manager and DBA team to ensure the database and application software and configuration adhere to organizational procedures and practices. This position requires the ability to work nights and/or weekends as necessary.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install and configure MS SQL and Oracle software: RDBMS, RAC and ASM. Creates production, test, and development database environments and instances as required
Monitoring Performance and Tune: Proactively Monitor database performance, diagnose performance problems, and tune the database as necessary. Investigate, gather diagnostic data for, and report to Support Services any critical database errors. Configure and manage memory allocation and adjust as needed. Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database
Provide leadership to the DBA team and work alongside management to accomplish business initiatives. Work closely with the Sys Admins and Business Analysts
Backup and recovery: Create a backup strategy, transaction log strategy & management, disaster recovery planning. Create or review the backup strategy for the database test backups with periodic, regular restores. Clones/restore instances with RMAN
Storage: Configure and manage storage, including tablespaces and datafiles, redo log files, and control files. Anticipate storage requirements; create or modify storage structures as needed before files are filled and cause application errors
Security: Configure and manage security, including database auditing
Patching: Keep Database software up-to-date with the latest patch releases
Education & Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 5 years' experience as DBA
In lieu of Bachelor's Degree and 5 years of experience working as a Database Administrator, will accept 7+ years of experience in Oracle Database Server Management or combination of education and experience
Expertise with Oracle Enterprise RDBMS 11g, including RAC and ASM
Expertise in MS SQL database and performance
Experience working with Linux or similar enterprise systems
Experience writing SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Skill in both verbal and written communication

…are excited to deliver great values to customers every day;
…take a sense of pride and ownership in helping drive positive results for a team;
…are committed to treating colleagues and customers with respect;
…believe in the power of diversity and inclusion;
…want to participate in initiatives that positively impact the world around you;
Come join our team. You’re going to like it here!
You will enjoy a competitive wage and comprehensive benefit package including a generous paid time off plan, a company matched 401(k) and an associate discount. We are a rapidly growing brand and provide a variety of professional development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. We work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.

Leading the future in luxury electric and mobility
At Lucid, we set out to introduce the most captivating, luxury electric vehicles that elevate the human experience and transcend the perceived limitations of space, performance, and intelligence. Vehicles that are intuitive, liberating, and designed for the future of mobility.

Lucid Motors is searching for a SQL Database Administrator for its Casa Grande area facilities. The Database Administrator will be responsible for monitoring, assessing the functionality, improvements and maintaining all SQL databases in the plant. The SQL Database Administrator will be the primary point of contact for SQL database related issues, interfaces to MES/SAP and will be responsible to ensure business continuity in the plant.
The Role
The SQL Administrator will be responsible for the integration, operation and maintenance of all SQL databases in the plant
Ensure the integrity and performance of databases
Monitor and maintain interfaces to MES/SAP
Guarantee that data is stored securely and optimally
Inform end users of changes in databases and train them to utilize systems
Ensure the security of company data
Lead project activities and service availability
Work on establishing consistent metrics for continuous improvement
Assist with defining the objectives of improvements, including developing and reviewing proposals and presentations
Review, develop, and support the implementation of modifications to meet future needs
Project Management
Qualifications
BS/MS in Information Technology/Computer Science or equivalent work experience
A minimum of 5+ years of experience in SQL Databases
Proven experience in SAP and MES Systems
Familiarity with database queries
Knowledge of database design and theories
Experience with server installation and maintenance
Familiarity with database management best practices
Knowledge of IT security best practices
Expert knowledge of computer programming (OPC, HTML, JAVA, Phyton, C Sharp, Visual Basic)
Problem solving skills specific to Information Technology, Network Management and System Design
Experienced in designing and implementing Business Continuity Plans and Disaster Recovery Plans
Strong analytical skills for interpreting business requirements and translating them into technical specifications
Project management experience
Manufacturing automotive experience

Coordinates the assessment, plan, implementation and evaluation of projects, including the acquisition of hardware and software. Work requires strong project management skills and experience with large project leadership. Work requires effective interpersonal, communication and leadership skills to promote growth as individuals, teams and as an organization. Work requires the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently to all levels of staff within the organization, in the written and oral form.. Work requires knowledge of a wide range of hardware and software for mainframes, PC's and networks to manage technical experts in the respective sections.


Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree preferred

Eight to Ten (8-10) years progressive experience in Information Services, five to seven (5-7) years experience supporting and/or managing large enterprise databases (i.e Epic Cache, Microsoft SQL, Oracle). (3) years leadership experience.

About DMI:
DMI (Digital Management, LLC.), the world’s first end-to-end mobility company, combines all the skills and services necessary to deliver mobile enterprise solutions. Built to reinvent business through mobility, DMI has expertise in mobile strategy, UX, web, and app development, omni-channel commerce, brand and marketing, IoT and big data analytics, and secure device and app management. The company’s unique, integrated approach to mobility has resulted in dramatic growth as well as an expanding client base, which includes hundreds of Fortune 1000 commercial clients and all fifteen U.S. Federal Departments. DMI is headquartered in Bethesda, MD, with satellite offices around the world. The company was named one of the 2018 Top Workplaces in the Washington, DC area by The Washington Post and received Inc. Magazine’s Hire Power Award as one of the top 100 Private Job Creators in the US. Additional information is available at www.dminc.com and on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

About the Opportunity:
DMI (Digital Management LLC) is looking for ADABAS Data Base Specialist remotely

Qualifications:
These personnel provide highly technical expertise and guidance in the interrelationship of the enterprise DBMS within the system software environment.
Each ADABAS Data Base Specialist must meet all the qualifications listed under Mandatory Core Competencies.
The ADABAS Data Base Specialist is responsible for installing, customizing, and maintaining the Data Center’s ADABAS Cluster Services environment and associated suite of Software AG (SAG) products.
ADABAS Cluster Services is fundamental to the Data Center high availability and continuous operating ADABAS environment. Availability of information and information systems are critical to OPM meeting its mission.

Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
1. Planning, installing, customizing, configuring, and implementing SAG suite of ADABAS software products.
2. Planning and executing disaster recovery for ADABAS and ADABAS related products.
3. Planning, creating, and managing table spaces in support DBAs.
4. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services and its add-on tools.
5. Planning, configuring, and implementing new DBMS technologies following OPM Change Control process.
6. Planning and implementing ADABAS support for structured and unstructured data.
7. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS support for SQL.
8. Planning, configuring, and implementing Natural and ADABAS security.
9. Planning, installing, configuring, customizing, and implementing ADABAS SAF security.
10. Planning and implementing performance improve that reduces CPU consumption.
11. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS buffering of data and indexes in main memory to decrease the number of physical reads and increase database performance.
12. Planning, configuring, customizing and implementing ADABAS Cluster Services.

28 -

AT 25742
Enterprise Mainframe Systems Support PWS
13. Planning, installing, configuring, and implementing ADABAS Online System (AOS).
14. Planning, configuring, and implementing Nucleus 64-bit processing support.
15. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS reporting of performance and resource consumption data through SMF.
16. Planning, configuring, and implementing ADABAS to comply with audits and regulatory requirements.
17. Providing technical assistance to PMOs’ DBMS programming and systems design staff.
18. Assisting in evaluating and setting database parameters.
MANDATORY CORE COMPETENCIES: ADABAS Data Base Specialist

Job Opening Summary

Reports to the Manager of Technical Services. Responsibilities include the implementation and maintenance of database along with integration (interfaces) to ensure optimal performance. Performs routine maintenance, monitors error logs and event history for database errors. Performs capacity checks to handle current and future business requirements. Forecasts potential database growth and space requirements based on current growth and performance patterns. Establishes standards and procedures for backups and recovery requirements. Enforces compliance for security and permissions for databases. Performs quarterly restore and disaster testing of critical databases.

Job Opening Qualifications

Required Education:
Associate's Degree OR two years specialized training in an applicable field (Business Administration, Allied Health, Computer Science, etc.) required. Related work experience may be substituted on a year-for-year basis in lieu of education.

Preferred Education:
Bachelor's Degree in an applicable field (Business Administration, Allied Health, Computer Sciences, etc.) preferred.

Necessary Skills:
1. Must possess strong organizational and self-direction skills.

2. Must be multi-skilled oriented.

3. Proficient in Windows Server 2003, 2008, 2012, MS SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2012, 2014, 2016.
4. Knowledge of Sybase, Cache and Oracle a plus.
5. Working knowledge of Networking, web-based technologies, and SQL programming.
6. Working knowledge of VMware and vSphere technologies.

Required Experience:
Three years experience in computer systems/network systems; preferably in a multiple systems environment.

Preferred Licensure/Certifications:
Project management, Microsoft Windows Server and Microsoft SQL Server

Come join our growing team at Burlington Stores as an Oracle Database Administrator IV! The senior Oracle database administrator (DBA) provides database and application administration support for the Burlington Stores, Inc. corporate office and all stores. T he Senior DBA will install, configure, maintain, and administer MS SQL and Oracle databases and application server software that includes RDBMS, RAC and ASM that run on the Linux platform. Our ideal candidate will be a part of the team to focus on performance, monitor, tune, troubleshoot, secure, provide backup and recovery, capacity planning, change control, and ensure business continuity for these services.
The senior DBA supports technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the group with respect to the database, application servers, and related storage and processing. W ork with the DBA manager and DBA team to ensure the database and application software and configuration adhere to organizational procedures and practices. This position requires the ability to work nights and/or weekends as necessary.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Install and configure MS SQL and Oracle software: RDBMS, RAC and ASM. Creates production, test, and development database environments and instances as required
Monitoring Performance and Tune: Proactively Monitor database performance, diagnose performance problems, and tune the database as necessary. Investigate, gather diagnostic data for, and report to Support Services any critical database errors. Configure and manage memory allocation and adjust as needed. Calculate optimum values for database parameters such as amount of computer memory to be used by database
Provide leadership to the DBA team and work alongside management to accomplish business initiatives. Work closely with the Sys Admins and Business Analysts
Backup and recovery: Create a backup strategy, transaction log strategy & management, disaster recovery planning. Create or review the backup strategy for the database test backups with periodic, regular restores. Clones/restore instances with RMAN

The database administrator is also responsible for the assessment and recommendation of large scale database platforms to meet the growing needs of Kaleida Health.

If no degree, 12 years relevant experience. 5 years of experience in SQL (Structured Query Language) required. 5 years of experience managing and implementing large scale database platforms including Oracle, Apache Hadoop/ Spark and EDW and data warehouse tools and Cerner HealtheIntent and EHR platform and relational database experience (Oracle, Mysql, Vertica, SQLserver, Postgres sql) preffered. 3 years of experience in database backup and recovery / Disaster Recovery preferred.

8+ years of DBA experience in Oracle, SQL Server, or other commercial/open source database platforms
Experience with migrating mission critical database environments from one platform to another
Experience working with high availability, disaster recovery and server tuning strategies including parameters, resources, contention, etc.
Experience in Shell/Perl/Python Scripting
Bachelor's degree in Computer science or equivalent experience

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired

Database Administrator III (Remote Available)
The award-winning Choice Hotels Technology Center is revolutionizing hospitality with cloud computing, AWS, big data, machine learning/artificial intelligence, and mobile application development.
At Choice, we pioneer the exciting intersection of hospitality and technology in support of our successful franchise model. Our culture fosters innovation and encourages disruptive thinking. We welcome and respect your voice, empowering you to learn, grow, and make your impact.
When you #MakeItYourChoice, you will have the environment, the tools, and momentum to drive your career and organizational success.
About This Opportunity
Choice Hotels is looking for a Database Administrator III to join our amazing team. The Database Administrator III provides administration for relational database infrastructure and management systems and supports Choice personnel who are users of these databases, including end users, software developers, operations staff and technical support staff. The DBA III typically serves as a lead resource for critical and non-critical database systems and is considered the subject matter expert on one or more database systems.
Your Contribution
Designs, documents and sets up database infrastructure, including hardware and operating systems.
Provides technical support for the database environment and supports internal teams in the use of databases
Under direction of from management and in coordination with different teams, plans, designs, installs and configures database systems and software.
Develops applications for data migration and maintenance.
Proactively monitors database system operations and activity. Performs system maintenance. Troubleshoots and resolves system performance issues in accordance with established standards and procedures.
Maintains database documentation and security.
Performs back-ups and restores and assists with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
Supports miscellaneous applications with client/server middleware.
Keeps up on industry trends and current technological standards, tools and operational considerations.
Makes suggestions for process, implementation, and performance improvements.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, from a four-year college or university, or three to five years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant industry certification is preferred.
Experience with AWS, Aurora MySQL and SQL Server a must.
A minimum of 7 years relevant experience in database administration, information systems, or equivalent technical environment. Previous experience supporting highly transactional, mission critical systems is mandatory.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database management systems.
Strong knowledge of a broad spectrum of infrastructure technologies and secure computing environments: network, hardware and operating systems, servers and storage.
Strong understanding of Service Oriented Architecture and relational application design and development.
Highly proficient with:
The required database platform and it’s components.
Database monitoring, tuning and optimization tools.
Database reporting, analytic and query tools and interfaces.
Database back-up technologies and tools.
Excellent analytical skills.
Excellent verbal, written and listening communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.
Demonstrated leadership and mentoring skills.
Proven self-starter.
Proficient in the use of MS Office applications, such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Ability to participate in 24x7 on-call rotation and perform after hours support, as needed.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment, both independently and collaboratively.
Ability to uphold Choice’s Values & Performance Principles of collaboration, performance excellence, sense of urgency, openness to new ideas, inclusion & diversity, integrity, customer focus, and respect.
Ability to model Choice’s Cultural Values: Welcome and Respect Everyone, Be Bold, Be Quick, Listen, Be Curious and Show Integrity.

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL, Uniontown, OH and London, Eng.

About the Role

As a Lead Database Administrator, you'll play a key role in developing our technology base and helping the company move forward to a more current technology stack. You'll be responsible for all aspects of database administration for our production and development database environments that support nearly 70+ million unique users a month (and growing). We currently have multiple production OLTP databases, a data warehouse and a half dozen staging and QA database servers.

Our DBA team focuses on creating, configuring and maintaining SQL Server and Postgres databases. In addition, they own our DR and HA strategies, and play an important part in setting the technology trends and standards we will be building upon in the future.

In this role you will work with a small, collaborative team of engineers and product managers – so good social and interpersonal skills are also a requirement. Most importantly, we're looking for an individual who can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver high-quality solutions.

Compensation: $144,000.00 - $180,000.00
At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.

At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:

Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)
Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)
Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller
cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)

You can learn more about our compensation philosophy here and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs here.
What You'll Do

As one of a team of 4, you'll need to be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the needs arise. You love to tackle problems and take independent action, seek out new responsibilities, act on opportunities, and generate new ideas

What You'll Bring
7+ years SQL Server Database Administration
Currently working with SQL Server 2019 with AlwaysOn Availability Groups in high volume, high availability production database systems
Production experience with Postgres
Experience with Cassandra and MongoDB a huge plus
Extensive knowledge of AWS - EC2 and RDS are required
Experience with both Windows and Linux administration highly desired
Experienced at troubleshooting performance issues related to CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other types of resource contention
Expertise in disaster recovery and high availability for SQL Server and Postgres
Knowledge of partitioning strategies and having worked with very large tables
Experience with PowerShell and/or other scripting languages highly preferred
A strong desire and ability to add to our culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion

Lucid Motors is searching for a SQL Database Administrator for its Casa Grande area facilities. The Database Administrator will be responsible for monitoring, assessing the functionality, improvements and maintaining all SQL databases in the plant. The SQL Database Administrator will be the primary point of contact for SQL database related issues, interfaces to MES/SAP and will be responsible to ensure business continuity in the plant.
The Role
The SQL Administrator will be responsible for the integration, operation and maintenance of all SQL databases in the plant
Ensure the integrity and performance of databases
Monitor and maintain interfaces to MES/SAP
Guarantee that data is stored securely and optimally
Inform end users of changes in databases and train them to utilize systems
Ensure the security of company data
Lead project activities and service availability
Work on establishing consistent metrics for continuous improvement
Assist with defining the objectives of improvements, including developing and reviewing proposals and presentations
Review, develop, and support the implementation of modifications to meet future needs
Project Management

A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.

Scientific Games:
Scientific Games (SG) is a global leader focused on delivering an ever-expanding portfolio of lottery and gaming products and services to the world's government-regulated and government-sponsored entities. Scientific Games' global reach is made possible through the expertise, skill and dedicated efforts of its 8,000+ employees who serve lottery and gaming customers in more than 100+ countries on 6 continents.

Gaming:
Are you ready to level up your career?

At Scientific Games, we are committed to making the best games, platforms and systems in the world. We are looking for smart, passionate and creative people to join our team and help us transform the gaming world. Whether you are a member of our award winning game studios, our industry leading systems group, product management, manufacturing group, services or any of our other amazing Gaming teams, you will be creating compelling games played around the world. We are dedicated to being the industry’s only COMPLETE global solutions provider with products that will enhance the entire gaming operation, both on the casino floor and behind the scenes.
If you are ready to play…Come join us and let’s make games!
Position Summary
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Create/maintain SQL configuration best practices & checklists.
Create DB health check & maintenance scripts, run books and SOPs.
Keeping up with major vendor announcements that affect DB performance and functionality.
Analyzing monitoring tool data and providing recommendations for performance improvements and efficiencies.
Minimize database downtime and manage parameters to provide fast query responses
Provide proactive and reactive data management support and training to users
Determine and document database policies, procedures and standards
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy and integrity
Monitor database performance, implement changes and apply new patches and versions when required
Evaluate new tools to improve database performance and monitoring.
Work with/assist teams within SG to ensure timely resolution to incident tickets.
Qualifications
Requirements :
3+ years of proven working experience as a DBA.
Experience using Infrastructure monitoring, helpdesk & ticketing systems
Hands-on experience with database standards and end user applications
Excellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQL
Familiarity with database design , documentation and coding
Previous experience with DBA case tools (frontend/backend) and third party tools
Familiarity with programming languages API
Problem solving skills and ability to think algorithmically
Azure or AWS experience a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skill
Ability to manage and trouble-shoot issues requiring problem resolution
Ability to work with others to accomplish business objectives
Must be highly organized self-starter
Ability to work a flexible schedule
Ability to work well with all levels of management
Assigned duties should be performed in a timely and accurate manner
Strict adherence to company policies, confidentiality, and mature judgment must be demonstrated at all times.
Must be eligible for Gaming Licenses in all jurisdictions
Must have or be eligible for US Passport or equivalent documents for international travel.
Must be able to travel 25% or more. Mostly domestic US.
Must have strong communication skills

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent technical training and work experience.

TTI, Inc. is seeking a Database Administrator (DB2). This person is accountable for the performance, maintenance, synchronization, security, and accessibility of all DB2 database systems with demonstrated proficiency in database replication, backup and restore, performance tuning and scalability. The position will require extensive custom DB2 development on the z/OS platform including stored procedures, views and provides technical support to application developers and end users. This position is accountable for troubleshooting system issues; developing and monitoring scheduled jobs and maintenance plans; and for proactively monitoring the performance of databases. Experience developing SQL Code for API use is a plus.
Headquartered in Fort Worth, TX, TTI, Inc. is the world’s leading authorized distributor of passive, connector, electromechanical and discrete components. Just celebrating its 50th anniversary, this Berkshire Hathaway company is ever-growing and has over 100 locations in North America, Europe, and Asia! Join a winning team in a growing global organization!
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Designs, implements and maintains the database architectures enhancing the integrity, security and performance of the database operating environment by collaborating with application developers, server administrators, project management, and end users to accomplish goals and objectives. Provides effective/accurate time estimates based on documented requirements
Develops, tests, and implements extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) processes from external and internal sources.
Provides effective support on a 24/7 on-call rotation basis by researching & analyzing issues to determine database related implications, effectively communicating with all impacted parties, and troubleshooting & resolving issues with a sense of urgency to minimize any system downtime.
Performs regular full and incremental backups of databases while adhering to the Recovery Time and Recovery Point objectives defined by the business. Periodically verify backups (e.g. by restoring to a test system). Participate in Disaster Recovery drills (i.e. bring databases online at DR site).
Monitors disk space on database and storage servers, CPU and Memory. Identify tuning opportunities for developers and provide tuning advice. Archive data as necessary to keep from using too much disk space.
Provides guidance/support for the Development Team on a regular basis. This includes collaborating with architects and developers to design and implement business processes.
Must prepare database documentation, including standards, procedures, best practices and data dictionary(s).
Must be able to plan, install and test software upgrades and patches where necessary.
Constantly look for opportunities to automate tasks and improve stability/ reliability.
Provides weekly status reports on database state/in-flight projects/maintenance schedules/etc.
Ensures future growth ramifications are considered in all design decisions, forecasting system and storage requirements to accommodate growth in data storage and performance needs. Continuously evaluates the operating performance of the database environment to ensure maximum performance by proactively monitoring the performance of all databases and by developing and implementing changes to enhance overall performance. Performs ongoing planning and monitoring of database size, performance, and hardware capacity.
Continually increases technical knowledge and proactively applies knowledge by keeping abreast of changes in technology via available resources, and utilizes this knowledge by recommending appropriate changes (e.g. programming techniques, software, performance measurement tools, systems and process, etc.).
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma or GED required. A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science plus five years of database development and administration experience; or equivalent combination of education or experience preferred.
SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS
Extensive knowledge & experience of DB2 (version 12 is a plus).
Expert experience in database Backup, Restore and Recovery procedures.
Experience with z/OS Mainframe platform.
Experience in building Stored Procedures.
Work collaboratively with other team members and application groups
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills and multitasking ability.
Show initiative, self-direction, and follow-through on assignments
Embraces and leads technological change and development
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively document procedures.
Ability to work weekends and after business hours.
Strong desire and passion to learn new technologies
Demonstrated commitment to quality.
IBM DB2 certification(s) are desirable.
Knowledge of competing database platforms.
Possess accurate keyboarding proficiency.

This full-time position is with a national program responsible for the technical development and maintenance of a database and website that support reporting of research and compliance-related processes for HSR&D.Under the direction of the Program Director, the Research Specialist will:· Manage and support technical development for the Program· Administer all aspects of a large SQL relational database; You.

You bring your body, mind, heart and spirit to your work as a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator.

You know how to move fast. You know how to stay organized. You know how to have fun.

You’re great at what you do, but you want to be part of something even greater. Because you believe that while individuals can be strong, the right team is invincible.

Us.

System Services is our Corporate Headquarters in Broomfield, Colorado and is located within the Oracle campus. SCL Health is a faith-based, nonprofit healthcare organization dedicated to improving the well-being of the people we serve.

Benefits are one of the ways we encourage health for you and your family. Our generous package includes medical, dental and vision coverage. But health is more than a well-working body: it encompasses body, mind and social well-being. To that end, we’ve launched a Healthy Living program to address your holistic health. Healthy Living includes financial incentives, digital tools, tobacco cessation, classes, counseling and paid time off. We also offer financial wellness tools and retirement planning.

We.

Together we’ll align mission and careers, values and workplace. We’ll encourage joy and take pride in our integrity.

We’ll laugh at each other’s jokes (even the bad ones). We’ll hello and high five. We’ll celebrate milestones and acknowledge the value of spirituality in healing.

We’re proud of what we know, which includes how much there is to learn.

Your day.

As a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator you need to know how to:


Performs activities related to the corporate-wide administration of database infrastructures, including defining, organizing, securing, ensuring efficiency, documenting, determining long term requirements and operational guidelines.

Provides operational services which maximize system availability, enhance security and optimize error-free process and job cycles.

Creates SQL Server database maintenance plans and jobs.

Provides responsive, high-quality customer support to resolve customer problems and respond to questions.

Interacts with other internal application teams and systems groups, to triage and diagnose issues related to assigned databases or areas.

Provides direction, coordination, guidance, and technical support and expertise related to the installation and implementation of all new instances and services and upgrades to existing systems.

Serves as the technical subject matter expert related to the assigned databases or areas.

Promotes mission, vision, and values of SCL Health, and abides by service behavior standards.

Performs other duties as assigned.


Your experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.


Database Management Software: Microsoft last 3 major product release versions, vendor specific backup and recovery methodologies, vendor specific build and configuration best practices, database lifecycle management tools required.

Knowledge of and hands on experience with setting up, monitoring and troubleshooting SQL Server Always ON Availability groups.

Working knowledge of SSAS, SSRS and SSIS.

Operating Systems Configuration/Management: Microsoft Windows operating environments, file systems, local or network storage device usage, scripting required.

Industry best practices and/or standards for database builds and configurations

LAN/WAN networking principles and knowledge and business and management principles preferred.

Ability to work nights and/or weekends is required for identified positions



Required:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information services, business administration, engineering, or related field required. 100% remote work position.

Preferred:

Five (5) years experience with Microsoft SQL Server database administration and disaster recovery methodology in an enterprise environment preferred. Experience in the healthcare industry is preferred. Understanding of Epic architecture and Clarity and Caboodle databases is preferred. Microsoft MCSA or DP-300

Your next move.

Now that you know more about being a Remote SQL Server Database Administrator on our team we hope you’ll join us. At SCL Health you’ll reaffirm every day how much you love this work, and why you were called to it in the first place.

A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.

Database Administrator IV Works under the general supervision of the Long Term Care Application Manager. This position is responsible for leading complex technical database activities for the information systems supporting the HHSC Division of Regulatory Services. Provides support in the development and maintenance of data warehouse and reporting systems. Develops, tests, debugs and documents highly complex program code to implement functional and design requirements for reporting systems in the agency. Participates in code walk-throughs. Assists in the development and maintenance of system documentation. Works with other members of the development team and end-users. Develops and maintains expertise in a variety of programming and database management tools. Develops technical and user documentation and supports training as required.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


1. Evaluates users' requests for new data elements and systems and incorporates into the existing shared data environment. Coordinates use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy. Loads databases and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. (30%)

Install and use Data Modeling tools like Erwin, Sql developer data modeler etc

Develop logical and physical Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams

Implement database objects in a Oracle RDBMS.

Advanced data modeler with experience in Design, creation, and maintenance data models representing production databases.

Generate scripts to be in the database using data modeler tools

Incorporating changes to data model design

Write source to target mapping instructions as needed to support ETL development

Develop stored procedures, database triggers and complex PL/SQL packages where needed.

Perform requirement analysis and provide data mapping guidance to application and development teams.

PL/SQL skills


2. Analyzes, designs, and implements databases. Determines and implements database search strategies. Determines database storage requirements. Develops and maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and sets standards for use of data dictionary. Establishes and controls necessary database security. (30%)

Evaluate the database server Hardware

Install database and grid software

Plan database for logical structure, overall database design and backup, restore strategy

Database performance analysis

Implement ASM for database storage or filesystem based database strategy

Follow database naming conventions per guidelines

If needed implement Oracle advanced security and Oracle database Vault

Database security solutions to ensure data privacy, protect against insider threats, and enable regulatory compliance

Implement oracle identity management to secure critical applications and sensitive data, lower operational costs, and comply with regulatory requirements.

- Directs the design, analysis and development of backup and recovery systems by working with the customer for support and implementation of more complex databases and environments. Serves as primary contact for vendors and system architects to represent customer requirements. Creates documentation for backup and recovery. Defines database validation requirements to ensure database integrity -Develops a plan and directs implementation of database security infrastructure that coincides with policy requirements, Makes recommendations for security best practices


3. Designs, codes and modifies complex computer programs, subroutines, triggers, stored procedures, objects, classes and scripts to maintain reporting systems. Performs necessary testing of assigned programs, including the generation of test data, writing test scripts/execution sequences, examining test results, debugging detected errors, etc. Uses current software development methods/techniques and established development standards (which include programming standards, documentation standards and testing standards) to ensure the quality and maintainability of reports/applications. Participates in code walk-thrus to ensure compliance with development standards and system/business requirements. (20%)


4. Works with trainers, technical support staff, network specialists and contract staff to perform modifications and/or updates to existing systems or to implement new systems. Identifies, investigates and resolves production problems. This may include analyzing problems, coding, testing, implementing and training of other technical staff and/or customers. (15%)


5. Other duties as assigned. (Note: This includes but is not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.) (5%)


Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of database management systems such as MS SQL Server and Oracle.

Knowledge of information systems project methodologies

Knowledge of general technical knowledge

Knowledge of and familiarity with personal computer hardware and peripheral equipment


Skills in computer programming

Skills in planning, scheduling and prioritizing work assignments

Skills in written and verbal communications

Skills in writing and testing code, including new and maintenance


Ability to analyze problems and develop solutions to correct the problems

Ability to analyze functional/design requirements and to develop solutions to implement the requirements

Ability to perform detailed work accurately and in accordance with standards

Ability to work and communicate effectively with others

Ability to meet deadlines and work on projects with changing priorities

Registration or Licensure Requirements:
A minimum of one (1) IT certification is preferred.


Initial Selection Criteria:
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, Management or related field. May substitute direct work experience on a year-for-year basis. Minimum of 7 years’ experience as a Database Administrator.


Additional Information:

MOS Code:
Army: 25B, 25D, 25N, 255A, 255S

Navy: CT, CTM, CTR, IT, 181X, 182X, 681X, 682X, 781X, 782X

Coast Guard: IT, C4I10, ISM

Marine Corps: 0171, 8848, 8858

Air Force: 3DOX2, 3DOX4

Overview: Nielsen Scarborough, the nation's premier source for local consumer insights through survey research, is looking for a skilled individual to join as a Database Analyst. This position involves heavy day-to-day data processing. The ideal candidate will thrive on working in a fast-paced production environment. The Database Analyst role requires strong numerical, logistical, and analytical skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Running Production processes and monitoring
Resolve database issues, queries and error reports in accurate and timely manner
Write SQL scripts, queries, stored procedures and functions for database systems
Perform quality assurance tests for ensuring data integrity and quality
Perform logistical summations on survey questions and their responses in relation to similar questions to determine proper alignment of data
Coordinate with team members to work with database tables based on project requirements
Test database systems and perform bug fixes
Update tables with logistical statements to connect data
Ensure that production deadlines are met, working closely within a team and other departments
Responsible for creation and support of final product for client delivery
Provide project updates and metrics to Manager on regular basis
Team with other Scarborough personnel on new development projects and assisting on existing projects as necessary
Create internal documentation for new processes and maintain documentation on existing processes
Participate in new software and hardware planning/implementation
Other duties as assigned by manager
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2+ years related experience
Strong working knowledge of Excel in particular working with macros
Programming experience in Visual FoxPro, MS SQL Server, MySQL, MS Access or similar platform required
Good understanding of data and schema standards and concepts
Detail oriented with strong numerical and analytical abilities to solve problems
Superior organizational, written and oral communication skills
Ability to prioritize workload from multiple departments
Ability to interact well within a team and to work independently
We believe a company is only as good as its people. Our goal is to create a diverse workplace where each team member is valued and respected. We offer a comprehensive employment package, including competitive compensation, excellent health care options, and 401K matching.
ABOUT NIELSEN
By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

Since 1984, Share Our Strength® has led the fight against hunger and poverty by inspiring and organizing individuals and businesses to share their strengths. Today, through the No Kid Hungry and Cooking Matters campaigns, Share Our Strength is ending childhood hunger in America by ensuring all children get the healthy food they need. No child should go hungry in America – we’re on our way to making that a reality and we want you to join us. We’re bold, creative, always open to new ideas and 100% dedicated to our mission. If that sounds like you, we’d like you to consider becoming part of our team.The Database Administration Coordinator, working under the supervision of the Associate Director, Database Administration, will be responsible for accurate and timely data entry. Additional responsibilities include assisting the Associate Director, Database Administration and Manager, Database Administration with RE NXT and Luminate database cleanup, list production, biographical updates, and routine administrative support. The Coordinator will understand best practices in data management, be able to identify and adapt to shifting priorities, be flexible and resourceful, and exercise professionalism and discretion in working with confidential information.The role is preferably based in Washington, DC, but could be fully remote for the right candidate. Range for offers: $50,000-$52,000.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESResponsible for assisting in the management of duplicate records in Luminate and RE NXT/ Raiser’s Edge, including identifying potential duplicates and merging records in both systems.Lead for data entry of new constituent biographical information, including attributes, relationships, actions, and notes into Raiser’s Edge.Serves as team back-up for daily online gift import process.Assist with large data pulls for the Direct Response program as well as Raiser’s Edge queries, imports, exports, and reporting, as requested.Responsible for daily quality control review and clean-up.Responsible for monthly and quarterly NCOA updates to the database.Supports large scale data hygiene projects, and Donor Operations team functions, including offline gift entry on an as-needed basis.Partner with colleagues to support Share Our Strength's work to be a diverse and inclusive organization, and ensuring this value is embedded in the organization and throughout our work.Perform other administrative assignments as needed.QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree preferred but not required, HS Diploma/GED required, plus 1-2 years’ experience in non-profit or other office settingProficient in Microsoft Office. Experience with a fundraising database – Raiser’s Edge proficiency a plus.Highly organized with the ability to handle differing projects and priorities while coordinating workflow in a deadline-driven and service-focused environment.Must be proactive and a self-starter, with excellent problem-solving and implementation skills.Excellent information management and organizational skills, with great attention to detail.Proven ability to collaborate effectively and to work well as a member of a team.Very strong interpersonal and communications (including verbal and written) skills and cultural competencies, underscored by strong emotional intelligence.Integrity and discretion, and a strong work ethic.Demonstrated interest in anti-hunger and anti-poverty issues.At Share Our Strength, we value an individual’s diversity of backgrounds, experiences, ideas and perspectives. A hallmark of our history, culture and values has been the organization’s desire to bring together motivated, intelligent, and talented people to work together to find and implement solutions to end hunger and poverty in the U.S. and abroad. Raytheon Intelligence and Space is seeking a Sr. Linux System Administrator/Database Administrator to join our team in operating and maintaining the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS) Common Ground System (CGS), a state-of-the-art ground station for the next generation of low earth orbiting environmental satellites. This system provides global coverage, monitor environmental conditions, collect, disseminate, and process data about the Earth's weather, atmosphere, oceans, land and near-space environment.


This position is a combination of Oracle/PostgreSQL database administration and Linux Systems administration in the JPSS environment.

As a System Administrator/Database Administrator the selected candidate will be part of a team responsible for troubleshooting, maintaining, and implementing solutions to optimize the infrastructure operations as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining the Oracle and Postgres relational databases. This work will include installations, upgrades, patching, tuning, systems integration, and systems analysis. Security of the Linux and database environments will be a top priority.


Duties can include, but not limited to:
Installation of database software upgrades, patch releases and system upgrades
Linux Systems Administration
Execution of recurring security maintenance and compliance functions across a widely dispersed ground system
Installation of workstations, installing licenses, and adding VMWare VMs.
Patch and Vulnerability evaluation, remediation, and work-off/closure of security findings
Database benchmarking, data manipulation, SQL and physical storage
Work location may be either Raytheon facility in Riverdale, MD or Aurora, CO. Position will be a combination of on-site (60-70%) and telecommuting

Qualified applicants must be a U.S. Citizen, will be subject to a security investigation, must be able to obtain a DOD Common Access Card (CAC) and pass a national agency check.

Required Skills:
5 years of experience with Linux Systems Administration and Database Administration
1 year minimum experience with Oracle 12 and/or 19
Experience with large VMWare environments
Oracle Support utility skills (PL/SQL, SQL, DataPump/export/import)
Experience with security requirements for databases, developing, documenting, and implementing backup and recovery procedures.
Hardware/software trouble shooting skills.
Scripting Experience (bash, Perl, Python)
Experience with database performance tuning, partitioning, blobs, database storage management, data security and protection, and performing backups/ restores.
Ability to establish and maintain good working relationship with all levels of an organization, including customers, engineering organizations, IPT members, supporting functional organizations.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Desired Skills:
Networking Experience
1 year experience with PostgresSQL
Windows Active Directory Experience
Experience with database modeling and design
AWS RDS database administration

Required Education:
University Degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 5 years of prior relevant experience.
Travel:
Occasional travel in the Continental United States.


Schedule:
Normal work hours are between 8am and 5pm; however, various mission activities will require a flexible work schedule, sometimes off-hours, weekends and possibly holidays depending on mission needs.

Benefits offered: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays.

In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role is $70,000 - $150,000; however, Raytheon Technologies considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education/training, and key skills.

Are you a Geology Professional who is looking for an exciting career? Nevada Gold Mines (NGM)has opportunities for career growth at your fingertips!
The Database Administrator I or II will perform administrative and technical duties in support of Geology and Engineering data sets. Work assignments are sophisticated in nature, where considerable judgment, tact, accuracy, and initiative are required in resolving problems of a technical nature.
At NGM, we are committed to a safe work environment sending every person home safe and healthy every day and leaving a sustainable legacy on our host communities. We offer a generous benefits package which includes a competitive medical, dental, and vision plan with national provider networks, a 401k retirement plan with employer contribution, paid time off, company-sponsored medical clinics, company match share purchase program, and much more!

Responsibilities:
Identify and develop program standards while consistently review current systems for continuous improvement.
Develop, implement and maintain database security methods to guarantee the data and database structures against improper access
Ensure integrity of data residing in the mission critical, department databases.
Maintain existing data sets including downloading new data from laboratories, existing databases, to reduce redundant stored data
Install and test new software application versions to ensure compatibility and functionality of current systems in order to assist application developers to ensure programming techniques result in optimum performance.
Maintain current documentation for existing in-house software applications, to generate reports, data listings, and develop documentation for new applications.
Interact positively with clients and provide expert technical assistance and training.
Develop and maintain documentation of database procedures and problem resolution.
Develop sophisticated Structured Query Language (SQL) application and database procedures, functions, forms, queries and reports. Provide guidance and training to Data Analysts and Database Administrators.
Project Management including performing systems analysis, scope of work, training, documentation and following systems change request protocols.
Estimate time and budget needed to complete projects.
Provide timely status reports of assigned projects.
Position may be required to travel to,and assist other domestic and international sites.
The above duties and responsibilities are representative of the nature and level of work assigned and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

Identify and develop program standards and best practices.

Qualifications:
B.S. in Computer Science or related field with 5 to 8 years of database administration and programming experience, or 7 to 9 years of combined database administration and programming experience.
Solid understanding of proper administration techniques for company's current database technology.
Demonstrable ability to program in high level programming languages preferably C#, web based .net, JavaScript, SQL, Microsoft Access and Visual Studio
Solid understanding in acQuire
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work well with others

What We Can Offer You
A comprehensive compensation package including a competitive medical, dental, and vision plan with national provider networks, a 401k retirement plan with employer contribution AND employer match, paid time off, company-sponsored medical clinics, company match share purchase program, and much more!
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
Endless opportunities to grow and learn with industry colleagues.
Access to a variety of career opportunities across the organization.
Nevada Gold Mines is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About Nevada Gold Mines
Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) is a joint venture between Barrick (61.5%) and Newmont (38.5%) that combined our significant assets across Nevada in 2019 to create the single largest gold-producing complex in the world. NGM produces approximately 3.5 million ounces of gold a year. The massive mining operation comprises eight mines along with their associated infrastructure and processing facilities and hosts three of Barrick’s Tier One assets: Carlin, Cortez, and Turquoise Ridge. At NGM, our mission is to be the world’s most valued gold mining business by finding, developing, and owning the best assets, with the best people, to deliver sustainable returns for our owners and partners.

A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.
