OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

CSUN strives to be a destination workplace, where everyone understands that they belong to a community that is vital in advancing student success and providing exemplary service to all stakeholders. We foster an environment of success, both for our students and our employees. We have a relentless passion for celebrating diversity, equity, and inclusion as well as being an employer of choice. You will also have the opportunity to realize your own personal goals and be recognized for the work you do, and enjoy the unique value the CSUN community can offer. If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the right place. Learn more: https://www.csun.edu/about-csun.

Major Duties
Under general supervision of the Director of Marketing and Engagement, the Database Associate directly oversees all patron databases utilized by The Soraya, including the YSNC ticketing database and YSNC data in the Development database, Raisers Edge. The incumbent maintains audience information such as contact information, ticket buying and donation history, and more.

Ensures all data is kept up to date and frequently “cleans” data to ensure accuracy and oversees coordination of data transfers between databases as needed.

Independently completes complex quantitative analysis and generates standard reports that aggregate key information and directly informs strategic decisions made by the development and marketing staff.

Supports Director of Marketing and Engagement and Director of Development through the research, collection, and presentation of data.

Performs other duties as assigned.
NOTE: To view the full position description including all of the required qualifications copy and paste this link into your browser: https://bit.ly/2VgNrqq

Qualifications
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field.
Equivalent to three (3) years of full-time, progressively responsible technical, analytical, or administrative experience.

Additional experience in job-related field may be substituted for up to two years of the required education, on a year for year basis.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Working knowledge of general practices, program, and/or administrative specialty and working knowledge of operational analysis and techniques. Thorough knowledge of data analytics.
Ability and specialized skills to expertly investigate and analyze problems with a broad administrative impact and implications.

Ability to: oversee and/or train others and provide lead work direction; interpret, and apply a wide variety of policies and procedures to develop conclusions and make recommendations; compile, write and present reports related to program or administrative specialty; and communicate clearly and effectively both orally and in writing.
Proficiency and extensive knowledge of patron management databases preferred, as well as excellent quantitative analysis skills.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
The university offers an excellent benefits package, including but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, retirement & savings, tuition waiver and more.
Classification: 1038 / Admin Analyst Spec
The anticipated HIRING RANGE: $ 3897-$5,100, dependent upon qualifications and experience. The salary range for this classification is: $3897 -$7051 per month.

HOURS: Full Time; 40 hours per week; Monday through Friday; may include evenings and weekends.
REG: This is a Regular position with a one-year probationary period.


General Information
Applications received through August 19, 2021, will be considered in the initial review and review of applications will continue until position is filled.

Overview: Nielsen Scarborough, the nation's premier source for local consumer insights through survey research, is looking for a skilled individual to join as a Database Analyst. This position involves heavy day-to-day data processing. The ideal candidate will thrive on working in a fast-paced production environment. The Database Analyst role requires strong numerical, logistical, and analytical skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Running Production processes and monitoring
Resolve database issues, queries and error reports in accurate and timely manner
Write SQL scripts, queries, stored procedures and functions for database systems
Perform quality assurance tests for ensuring data integrity and quality
Perform logistical summations on survey questions and their responses in relation to similar questions to determine proper alignment of data
Coordinate with team members to work with database tables based on project requirements
Test database systems and perform bug fixes
Update tables with logistical statements to connect data
Ensure that production deadlines are met, working closely within a team and other departments
Responsible for creation and support of final product for client delivery
Provide project updates and metrics to Manager on regular basis
Team with other Scarborough personnel on new development projects and assisting on existing projects as necessary
Create internal documentation for new processes and maintain documentation on existing processes
Participate in new software and hardware planning/implementation
Other duties as assigned by manager
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2+ years related experience
Strong working knowledge of Excel in particular working with macros
Programming experience in Visual FoxPro, MS SQL Server, MySQL, MS Access or similar platform required
Good understanding of data and schema standards and concepts
Detail oriented with strong numerical and analytical abilities to solve problems
Superior organizational, written and oral communication skills
Ability to prioritize workload from multiple departments
Ability to interact well within a team and to work independently
We believe a company is only as good as its people. Our goal is to create a diverse workplace where each team member is valued and respected. We offer a comprehensive employment package, including competitive compensation, excellent health care options, and 401K matching.
ABOUT NIELSEN
By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.

Travel Required: Less than 10%
Public Trust: NACLC (T3)
Requisition Type: Pipeline
GDIT’s Military Health IT Team is HIRING a Database Analyst to support GDIT’s Military Health Division across various locations. As a Database Analyst at GDIT you will be responsible for designing, planning, implementing, and administering databases, including security, access, and documentation while supporting the customer. You will be trusted to work with a variety of different technologies.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyzes customer requirements and develops technical solutions to complex problems.
May manage the development of database standards, policies, and SOPs and ensures their conformance with the USPS goals and company/customer objectives
Applies knowledge of API (Application Programming Interface) for data services and databases.
Designs, develops, builds, analyzes, evaluates, installs, and administers database management systems to include database modeling and design, relational database architecture, metadata and repository creation, and configuration management.
Prepares system requirements, source analysis, and process analyses and design throughout the database implementation.
Responsible for 24X7 production and maintenance support on a rotation basis for all database stand-alone and clustered instances
Responsible for monitoring database server health, disk performance, monitoring, and history tool
Defines and oversees database organizations, standards, controls, procedures, and documentation.
Provides technical consulting in the definition, design, and creation of a database environment.
Advises applications development staff and users on data-based solutions to business problems, data architectures, database management system facilities and capabilities, and the operation and tuning of databases.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
2+ or more years’ experience in database analysis and/or administration
Experience with database administration activities including installation, configuration, monitoring, space management, database backup and recovery, and disaster recovery
Excellent verbal and communications skills
US Citizenship required
Ability to obtain a NACLC (T3) investigation
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
An intermediate or above level of proficiency with MS Office products (E.g., Word, PowerPoint, Access)
Demonstrated experience regularly troubleshooting systems functionality
Demonstrated experience consulting with internal and external customers to understand business and technical needs, and make recommendations as needed
WHAT GDIT CAN OFFER YOU:
401K with company match
Challenging work that makes a real impact on the world around you
Diverse, highly collaborative teams
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.

The likely salary range for this position is $65,714 - $109,742, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

Job Description
GDIT is seeking Database Administrators at multiple levels to support a $100M+ US Navy program that provides full spectrum Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Combat Systems, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) technical support to the warfighter in the Continental United States (CONUS), Outside the Continental United States (OCONUS), and in hazardous areas. These critical C5ISR solutions will support a broad range of Department of Defense (DoD) and non-DoD customers, including joint forces commands and disaster recovery/first responders.
In support of this program, GDIT will perform and provide computer systems engineering services to perform tasks in support of assigned Distance Learning (DL) related technologies and systems including Learning Management Systems (LMS) and Knowledge Management Systems (KMS) support.
Program tasking includes provisioning of infrastructure (hardware, software, and cloud services), infrastructure operational support, content development and training, software development, maintenance and enhancement, and some Help Desk support. The GDIT team will supply a full range of system capabilities to include all infrastructure and unique implementation elements. Additionally, the team will develop knowledge sharing strategies and techniques, and deploy various custom systems, that will support distance education and training content, and instructor led training, and producing professional training.
Duties of the Database Administrator may include, but not be limited to the following (at varying levels of difficulty depending on level of position):Support the maintenance and following of a Configuration Management Plan (CMP) that may include a database encompassing a complete list of system assets for tracking, maintaining, validating, and auditing all system components.Maintain databases that track the following functions: Security, HD, infrastructure, systems, and subsystems.Conduct database administration to include ad-hoc, custom, canned reporting, data synchronization, log review management, performance monitoring, and database health optimization.Document all current database specifications including descriptions of the organization of the database structure, field tables, storage requirements, and record linkages.Maintain databases within an application area while working individually or coordinating database development as part of a team.Administer, test, and implement computer databases, applying knowledge of database management systems.Coordinate changes to computer databases. Identify, investigate, and resolve database performance issues, database capacity, and database scalability.May plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard computer databases.Levels
A senior level person typically works on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program and performs all functional duties independently. A senior level person may oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job.
A journeyman level person typically performs all functional duties independently.
A junior level person is responsible for assisting more senior positions and/or performing functional duties under the oversight of more senior positions.
REQUIRED CLEARANCE/EDUCATION/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:
Clearance – Active Secret
Education
A senior level person has at least ten (10) years of experience and a master’s degree, or a qualifying substitution, if identified.
Bachelors degree plus four (4) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a Masters degree.
Six (6) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
Associate degree plus four (4) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
A journeyman level person within a labor category has three (3) or more years of experience and a bachelor’s degree or a qualifying substitution, if identified.
Six (6) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
Associate degree plus four (4) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
A junior level person within a labor category has less than three (3) years of experience and a bachelor’s degree or a qualifying substitution, if identified.
Six (6) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
Associate degree plus four (4) years of additional work experience related to the applicable labor categories; required experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
Database Administration experience, preferably within a DoD program environment.
For a senior level position at least 10 years of experience in Database Administration.
For a journeyman level position at least 3 years of experience in Database Administration.
For a junior level position less than 3 years of experience in Database Administration.
Levels for experience below
A senior level person may oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job.
A journeyman level person typically performs all functional duties independently.
A junior level person is responsible for assisting more senior positions and/or performing functional duties under the oversight of more senior positions.
Administering, testing, and implementing computer databases, applying knowledge of database management systems.
Coordinating changes to computer databases.
Identifying, investigating, and resolving database performance issues, database capacity, and database scalability.
Planning, coordinating, and implementing security measures to safeguard computer databases.
Design strategies for enterprise databases, data warehouse systems, and multidimensional networks is required for a senior level position.
Set standards for database operations, programming, query processes, and security.
Model, design, and construct large relational databases or data warehouses.
Create and optimize data models for warehouse infrastructure and workflow.
Integrate new systems with existing warehouse structure and refine system performance and functionality.
DESIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:Be able to administer, test, and implement computer databases, applying knowledge of database management systems.Be able to coordinate changes to computer databases. Identify, investigate, and resolve database performance issues, database capacity, and database scalability.Be able to plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard computer databases.One or more of the following Database Certifications: Microsoft SQL, IBM, OracleExperience with systems administration support for large-scale environments.Experience installing and configuring Oracle databasesExperience installing and configuring Microsoft SQL databaseExperience conducting database administration to include ad-hoc, custom, canned reporting, data synchronization, log review management, performance monitoring, and database health optimization.Demonstrated innovative thinking and follow throughDemonstrated rapid response to customer requestsExperience in researching new/emerging technologies

Company Name: State of Washington Dept. of Transportation
Description:
Description


About WSDOT
Washington State Department of Transportation (WSDOT) is the steward of an integrated, multimodal transportation system that helps to ensure people and goods move safely and efficiently throughout the state. In addition to building, maintaining, and operating the state highway system, WSDOT operates the largest ferry system in the nation, manages the world's longest floating bridge, and recently completed the world's widest tunneling project.

The Opportunity
WSDOT Information Technology Division (ITD) is currently seeking a Database Administrator. This position is part of the WSDOT Information Technology Division’s Data Management Services Data Resource Management Team. Data Management Services designs, builds, and supports databases for WSDOT and facilitates the usability of data for the agency. Data Resource Management (DRM) provides WSDOT’s database administration support for five areas of expertise: Mainframe, Transactional Structured Query Language (SQL) Databases, Oracle DB, GIS, and Data Warehouse. DRM also provides data provisioning services in the form of stored procedures, views, functions, web services and extract, transform and load (ETL) routines to provide an integrated data environment for the agency. This position reports directly to the Microsoft SQL and Oracle Database Administrator and Integration Team Lead and is responsible for the administration, maintenance of modernized, cloud hosted databases and data integration processes, as well as supporting the department’s legacy on premise data warehouse databases hosted in Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Analysis Services.

What to Expect
This Database Administrator provides advanced skill level database administration and maintenance of the department’s Microsoft SQL databases, and Azure SQL Databases. This position supports the department’s modern data transformation platform Azure Data Factory and legacy Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services data integration packages. WSDOT’s data environment consists of more than 1,100 databases and serves 8,000 employees agency-wide. This position is the data integration technical lead and team supervisor for transactional system data integration for on premise applications, vendor provided and hosted applications. This position supervises the transactional data integration team.

Among the varied range of responsibilities held within this role, the Database Administrator will:
Provide database administration for Microsoft SQL Server and Azure databases for transactional and decision support systems.
Analyze, debug, and resolve complex problems with SQL-based applications.
Guide development staff in the use of T-SQL and complex coding problems.
Utilize current DevOps methodologies to manage database objects, including creating, modifying, and removing databases and database objects such as tables, stored procedures and security roles.
Function as the department’s technical expert and management advisor on the administration of the department’s Data Warehouse and Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) database environment.
Provide business analysis and project management for data integration projects.
Supervise the data integration team.
Design, develop, and implement data integrations for transactional systems.

Qualifications
To be considered for this opportunity, the following are required:

Eight (8) years of experience working in Information Technology within data management or application development OR Six (6) years of experience working in Information Technology within data management or application development and a four-year degree in computer science, mathematics, or closely related field.
Five (5) years of technical experience administering Microsoft SQL Server and related products.
Five (5) years of experience managing, developing, and troubleshooting data integration processes.
Five (5) years of experience writing complex routines for reporting and data validation purposes.
One (1) year of experience architecting and developing database systems in a cloud hosted environment.

It is preferred that qualified candidates also have:

An Associate degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, or related field.
Experience working with Mainframe systems, data sets and databases.
Experience working in multiple Information Technology (IT) job families such as Data Management, Application Development, System Administration, Project Management.
Experience managing IT projects.

Important Notes

This recruitment may also be used to fill additional positions per business needs.
By issuance of proclamation, the Governor of Washington State mandates that all employees who work for executive cabinet agencies (which includes the Department of Transportation) must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This is a condition of employment with WSDOT. Exemption may be granted for religious or medical purposes; however, accommodations will be subject to approval based on the essential functions required of the position.
Due to the COVID-19 restrictions, this position will be remote in a telework capacity full-time. Once the restrictions are lifted, WSDOT supports a flexible work schedule with partial telework opportunities, depending on business needs and prior supervisor approval.

Why WSDOT

Work-Life Balance – We are committed to ensure that our staff experience the reward of public service, while also sustaining a routine that suits each individuals’ lifestyle.
Paid Leave – In addition to 11 paid holidays, full-time employees earn a minimum 14 paid vacation days per year!
Tuition Assistance – Permanent employees have several options for assistance with education expenses, including tuition reimbursement programs, government discounts at participating colleges throughout the state, and eligibility for federal student loan forgiveness.
Plan For Your Future – WSDOT offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a variety of healthcare options. Employees also have their choice of state retirement programs, and much more. Go to State Benefits for more information.

Check out this video to learn more: Why WSDOT?

How to Apply
Applications for this recruitment will be accepted electronically. Your relevant experience may be evaluated to determine salary. Therefore, it is very important that the “Work Experience” portion of the application be completed in as much detail as possible.
In order to be considered for this opportunity, please include the following with your online application:

An attached Resume outlining (in reverse chronological order) your experience to date.
An attached Cover Letter that further explains your qualifications and indicates why you believe you are a viable candidate for this role.
Contact details for a minimum three (3) individuals who can attest to your work performance, technical skills, and job-related competencies. This information can be entered in the “References” section of the online application; does not require an additional attachment.

Please click the "APPLY" button to proceed. Note that you will be prompted to either sign in or create an account. This step is required in order to submit an application to this opportunity.

WSDOT is an equal opportunity employer. We value the importance of creating an environment in which all employees can feel respected, included and empowered to bring unique ideas to the agency. Our diversity and inclusion efforts include embracing different cultures, backgrounds and viewpoints while fostering growth and advancement in the workplace. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, persons of disability, persons over 40 years of age, disabled and Vietnam era veterans, as well as people of all sexual orientations and gender identities are encouraged to apply. Persons with disabilities needing assistance in the application process, or those needing this job announcement in an alternative format may contact the listed Recruiter.

WSDOT does not use the E-Verify system. For more information, please visit www.uscis.gov

Contact us
For inquiries about this posting, you may contact the assigned Recruiter, Amanda Strebeck, at strebal@wsdot.wa.gov Please be sure to reference Database Administrator # 01334 in the subject line.

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. A career with Johnson County Government is more than just a job, it is an opportunity to serve a diverse and expanding community in meaningful ways. We challenge ourselves to be a different kind of government because we care deeply about our community and each other. Johnson County's Department of Technology and Innovation delivers innovative and reliable technology solutions and services to advance the objectives of County staff, elected officials, and the community in a cost effective and efficient manner. Database Administrators (DBA) plans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of our systems. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Although primary responsibilities will include Microsoft SQL Server, the successful candidate will also support MySQL and Oracle databases, both on premise and in the cloud. Johnson County believes in continuous improvement and is committed to training and empowering our staff.
Leads in the optimization of the physical design to meet system performance and storage requirements and performs capacity planning; researches and develops solutions to enhance system usability and functionality.
Controls access permissions and privileges.
Leads the development, management and testing of back-up and recovery plans; ensures adherence of storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures.
Installs, tests and deploys patches.
Leads development and assists developer analysts in ongoing system application support by working closely with IT project managers, database programmers and web developers and performs troubleshooting.
Communicates regularly with technical, applications and operations staff to ensure database integrity and security.
Collaborates on the conceptual design of a planned database and refines the logical design for translation into a physical data model to include both back-end organization of data and front-end accessibility for end-users.
Leads the installation, testing and deployment of new databases and performs data conversion.
Creates, maintains and implements database practices and standards to comply with applicable regulations; reviews, writes and maintains database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata).
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in the following field(s) of study: Information Systems, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering and four years relevant experience as a software engineer, programmer or development analyst are required.
Experience can substitute for education. Education can substitute for experience.

Nevada Gold Mines (NGM) is a joint venture between Barrick (61.5%) and Newmont (38.5%) that combined our significant assets across Nevada in 2019 to create the single largest gold-producing complex in the world. Develops and maintains expertise in a variety of programming and database management tools. Develops technical and user documentation and supports training as required.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.


1. Evaluates users' requests for new data elements and systems and incorporates into the existing shared data environment. Coordinates use of data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy. Loads databases and reorganizes as needed. Performs data modeling and prototyping. (30%)

Install and use Data Modeling tools like Erwin, Sql developer data modeler etc

Develop logical and physical Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams

Implement database objects in a Oracle RDBMS.

Advanced data modeler with experience in Design, creation, and maintenance data models representing production databases.

Generate scripts to be in the database using data modeler tools

Incorporating changes to data model design

Develop stored procedures, database triggers and complex PL/SQL packages where needed.

Perform requirement analysis and provide data mapping guidance to application and development teams.

PL/SQL skills


2. Analyzes, designs, and implements databases. Determines and implements database search strategies. Determines database storage requirements. Develops and maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and sets standards for use of data dictionary. Establishes and controls necessary database security. (30%)

Evaluate the database server Hardware

Install database and grid software

Plan database for logical structure, overall database design and backup, restore strategy

Database performance analysis

Implement ASM for database storage or filesystem based database strategy

Follow database naming conventions per guidelines

If needed implement Oracle advanced security and Oracle database Vault

Database security solutions to ensure data privacy, protect against insider threats, and enable regulatory compliance

Implement oracle identity management to secure critical applications and sensitive data, lower operational costs, and comply with regulatory requirements.

- Directs the design, analysis and development of backup and recovery systems by working with the customer for support and implementation of more complex databases and environments. Serves as primary contact for vendors and system architects to represent customer requirements. Creates documentation for backup and recovery. Defines database validation requirements to ensure database integrity -Develops a plan and directs implementation of database security infrastructure that coincides with policy requirements, Makes recommendations for security best practices


3. Designs, codes and modifies complex computer programs, subroutines, triggers, stored procedures, objects, classes and scripts to maintain reporting systems. Performs necessary testing of assigned programs, including the generation of test data, writing test scripts/execution sequences, examining test results, debugging detected errors, etc. Uses current software development methods/techniques and established development standards (which include programming standards, documentation standards and testing standards) to ensure the quality and maintainability of reports/applications. Participates in code walk-thrus to ensure compliance with development standards and system/business requirements. (20%)


4. Works with trainers, technical support staff, network specialists and contract staff to perform modifications and/or updates to existing systems or to implement new systems. Identifies, investigates and resolves production problems. This may include analyzing problems, coding, testing, implementing and training of other technical staff and/or customers. (15%)


5. Other duties as assigned. (Note: This includes but is not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency’s obligations for disaster response and/or recovery or Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternate shift pattern assignment and/or location.) (5%)

Knowledge of and familiarity with personal computer hardware and peripheral equipment

The role of senior database administrator has two key aspects: technological and customer-service leadership. The senior database administrator also provides leadership, technical guidance, training, and mentoring to others in areas of acquired expertise. The candidate is responsible for the efficient application of currently relevant and appropriate emerging technology in the development of quality products within the constraints of time and budget.
This position is Remote but reserved for the Eastern and Central US time zones.
Responsibilities
Design and collaborate on designs of new database platforms.
Write and review code associated with database queries and automation.
Optimize query and database performance.
Install, configure, patch, upgrade, backup, and monitor databases and database servers.
Respond to problems and changes with the highest degree of complexity and risk.

Drive adherence to Incident, Change, and Problem Management process.
Drive standardization.
Create and enable appropriate documentation of systems, processes, recovery, and troubleshooting.
Mentor other associates and model collaborative, customer-centric professionalism.
Learn new features and new platforms continuously, to enable and lead change.
Automate install, configure, scale up/down, backup/recovery, disaster recovery, and monitoring.
Develop processes and automation to manage the databases.
Provide off-hour assistance and support during critical outage situations.
Participate in a 24 x 7 on call rotation.
Qualifications

Strong database administration experience in Oracle, with minium 5 years experience.
Experience working on cross functional teams, multitasking, and managing time independently with little direction.

Job Description
GDIT is seeking Database Administrators at multiple levels to support a $100M+ US Navy program that provides full spectrum Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Combat Systems, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) technical support to the warfighter in the Continental United States (CONUS), Outside the Continental United States (OCONUS), and in hazardous areas. These critical C5ISR solutions will support a broad range of Department of Defense (DoD) and non-DoD customers, including joint forces commands and disaster recovery/first responders.
In support of this program, GDIT will perform and provide computer systems engineering services to perform tasks in support of assigned Distance Learning (DL) related technologies and systems including Learning Management Systems (LMS) and Knowledge Management Systems (KMS) support.
Program tasking includes provisioning of infrastructure (hardware, software, and cloud services), infrastructure operational support, content development and training, software development, maintenance and enhancement, and some Help Desk support. The GDIT team will supply a full range of system capabilities to include all infrastructure and unique implementation elements. Additionally, the team will develop knowledge sharing strategies and techniques, and deploy various custom systems, that will support distance education and training content, and instructor led training, and producing professional training.

Detail oriented with strong numerical and analytical abilities to solve problems

OVERVIEW:
KS2 Technologies, Inc. is looking to aggressively grow our JD Edwards Practice and is hiring a full-time Oracle/SQL Database Administrator (DBA) consultant as a result. The DBA Consultant role at KS2 Technologies is responsible for technical design, administration, implementation, upgrade and managed services of Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 2008 and newer. You will also be expected to refine and automate regular processes, track issues and document changes. In addition to the DBA tasks, the DBA consultant will support KS2 initiatives as it relates to ERP JD Edwards applications, interfaces, service oriented architecture (SOA), cloud and web based portals for customers. The ideal candidate will be able to meet directly with clients (Via Zoom during COVID). They will need to have the ability to provide technical analysis, make the appropriate recommendations, communicate thoroughly and execute timely for each project.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Maintain backups and recovery of databases
Develop, design, implement and debug stored procedures, triggers, and indexing
Implement High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery plans
Optimize database performance and ensures availability
Clone, recover and migrate databases
Execute and maintain maintenance plans & index statistics
Maintain database security
Provide technical support to include proactive and reactive incident resolution
Review system logs to identify signs of potential problems
Write, execute and peer review SQL, T-SQL and PL/SQL scripts and functions
Perform database upgrades
Perform performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Administer third-party applications that require Oracle AND MS SQL server support as needed
SSIS package development, deployment, monitoring and troubleshooting
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES FOR DBA:
Experience with MSSQL Server 2008 or newer
Experience working with scripting tools (Powershell, OS-Level scripts, Java-Scripts)
Experience with Oracle Databases 11g or newer
Working experience using JD Edwards EnterpriseOne application on MSSQL and Oracle database is a plus
Infrastructure / server management in public / private clouds utilizing AWS, Oracle or Azure
Experience monitoring database performance
Experience as a Consultant in a Professional Services organization
Be a highly motivated individual and multitask oriented
Effective in person, phone, and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team environment while achieving personal production goals
Excellent problem-solving skills.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
5+ years as MS SQL Server DBA with 5+ years as Oracle DBA (must have both)
Certified Oracle DBA
ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE AND CONSIDERATIONS FOR ORACLE/SQL DBA:
Linux platform experience desired but not required
Ability to manage technical projects
Core value fit:
Better Together - Together, we work hard, collaborate constantly, lift one another up, and challenge each other to do our best work.
People Matter - We love computers, but people are our biggest source of success.
Take the High Road - Trust, integrity, respect and accountability in all relationships.
H3 Hungry, humble, hustle
Good is Not Good Enough We aspire to be the very best
No sponsorship / must be US citizen
No H1B Visas
Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment
COMPENSATION:
KS2 Technologies compensates our JD Edwards DBA consultants with a competitive base salary, a quarterly bonus plan, and a benefits package that includes a health care plan, dental, 401k with match, PTO and paid holidays. We recognize top performers with elevated bonus and growth opportunities. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys working together that performs well and celebrates our successes.
REQUIRED EDUCATION:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience
TRAVEL REQUIRED:
Up to 15% domestic travel may be required to work (to Client specific locations).
Great team work, family atmosphere, and a values-driven culture can be expected when joining our team. We are looking for that special individual that understands what it takes to be successful in our industry and is looking for a great team to call "home" for the long-term.
KS2 Technologies, based in Grapevine, TX, is an industry leader in IBM and Oracle Software Consulting Services and Product Licensing / Resell. KS2 is an IBM Gold Business Partner and Oracle Platinum Partner. In business for over 20 years, KS2 has been passionate about delivering world-class service and value to our clients for IBM Hardware / Infrastructure, Oracle JD Edwards ERP systems, and IBM Cloud and Middleware products (Cast Iron, DataPower, MQ, IIB, Bluemix, etc). KS2's Consulting Service Engagement Models and client portfolio enables placement of consultants locally and nationally - depending on our client and project needs.

Company Name: UT Health Science Center at San Antonio
Description:
Job Summary:
Responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of the Oracle database(s) to include Peoplesoft administration and related activities. Ensures the integrity, performance and availability of the database for optimal storage and retrieval. Managing Linux databases running under Real Application Cluster (RAC).
Work Schedule: Remote work available. Will be required to come to in person meetings when needed.

Job Duties:
Ensures sound database definitions, structures and documentation to include operations manual, system recovery strategies, system data flow diagrams, database architecture, user security and other similar post-deployment documentation.
Designs security and integrity controls.
Maintains and monitors the Oracle database environment(s).
Designs and analyzes policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
Provides technical advice and recommendations to departments requesting specialized support or services.
Performs all other duties as assigned.

Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering is required.
Experience:
Five (5) years of industry experience as an Oracle DBA is required.

Preferred:
Experience with Peoplesoft, Linux, ASM, RAC, current storage technologies, and VMware.

As a Junior SQL DBA, you will participate in the delivery of projects focusing on modern data management techniques and solutions to completion in a team environment while demonstrating a consultative personality, leadership mindset, and collaborative communication style.
What you will do
Participate in the delivery of a variety of Managed Infrastructure and Analytics projects and solutions to completion in a team environment while demonstrating a consultative personality, leadership mindset, and collaborative communication style.
Demonstrate and be able to communicate an understanding of Microsoft SQL Server concepts, especially Enterprise-edition and features introduced in SQL Server 2016+.
Manage SQL Server Databases in various migration projects from on-premise environments to Azure environment.
Execute T-SQL troubleshooting, query optimization, indexing and Enterprise-edition features.
SSRS, SSIS and/or Azure Data Factory development using the project deployment model, demonstrated familiarity with enterprise ETL concepts.
Using SQL Server Data Tools for developing source-controlled database projects in a team environment
Troubleshooting SQL Server maintenance, configuration and High Availability solutions, specifically multi-subnet Availability Groups.
Product knowledge and guidance around SQL Server including in Azure, to help our customers plan for Azure migrations and expansion.
Live out the Sparkhound Core Values.
Other duties and tasks as assigned.
Required Qualifications
2+ years of experience with SQL Server 2012+
Four-year degree (or work experience equivalent)
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Successful completion of at least 1 relevant Microsoft certification exam
The ideal candidate will demonstrate skills and applicable experience in all of the following:
Programming Languages: T-SQL, PowerShell
Lifecycle Tools: Github, Visual Studio Online, Azure DevOps
Database Engines: SQL Server 2016+
High Availability: SQL Server Availability Groups, Windows Server Failover Clustering
Tools: SSMS, Data Tools (SSIS, SSRS), VS Code, Azure Data Factory
Perks and Benefits
Customizable Health Benefits
Open Time Off
Inclusive Company Culture
Flexible Work Environment
Exclusive Employee Discounts
Lighthearted Banter from Supportive Coworkers

With multiple locations throughout the United States, Sparkhound is dedicated to enabling our clients’ businesses through leadership and digital transformation. We are on the talent hunt for problem solvers that can collaborate and partner with our clients to plan, build and run lasting business solutions.

Position Overview:
The DBA II role is challenging and rewarding as we expend our business to multiple geographies, converge online and kiosk functionalities and grow the sales channels. We have strong foundational tech and we are working with leading cloud technologies such as RDS.
The DBA II position requires strength in all aspects of database design and administration. You’ll work within the data infrastructure development team in an agile environment to provide high-quality data platform solutions and will play an active role in projects from inception to delivery.
For this role, we seek a candidate who desires to learn new technologies, works well with various teams, is good at understanding complicated issues and solving problems and at the same time, and most of all, is excited to grow his/her skills as a DBA. And can have a little fun at the same time.
Key Responsibilities:
Hands-on administration of global database
Resolve performance issues with an emphasis on root cause identification
Assist in development and maintaining necessary documentation
Maintain metrics in necessary areas of responsibility
Assist in planning and executing the merging of multiple disparate databases into a single, cohesive one.
Respond to issues and support calls
Monitor database operations and support maintenance activities
Other duties as assigned
Education & Experience
BS Computer Science or equivalent education + experience
Knowledge and experience in database design methodology
Knowledge and Experience with SQL Server
Strong motivation to advance as a DBA
Good problem-solving skills
Desire and ability to learn new processes and technologies
Good oral and written communication skills
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Experience with SQL Server
Experience with MySQL
Experience with database PaaS/RDS
Business Travel
10% of time

The right candidate will explore a range of business questions, ultimately helping the company to achieve its financial and operational goals, through sophisticated data analysis and applying business acumen. Therefore the candidate should be comfortable presenting financial information to all levels of management in a clear and concise way.Responsibilities of the Financial Database Analyst include, but are not limited to the following:Create and deliver key financial and operational metrics in a timely manner to support company initiatives and board reportingDevelop and maintain reporting tools across various functional areasPartner with members of the senior management team to develop critical reporting requirementsParticipate in the strategic planning process and provide insights and ideasIdentify opportunities to enhance the efficiency of existing processes and propose improvements to streamline the use of key business metricsGather, organize, and interpret statistical data from the database to provide reports to, and answer questions from, upper managementOther duties as assigned and directed by your SupervisorDesired Qualifications:Advanced Excel skills a must, SQL, Python and PowerQuery experience desiredAbility to work with large sets of data from various systems to drive meaningful analysisBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field, preferred.1-3 years’ experience with financial analysis and financial reporting, preferredDesired Attributes:Strong analytical skills and ability to apply business knowledgeExcellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsTakes initiative and ownership of their roleAbility to work under tight deadlines and multitaskFlexibility to adapt to the changing needs of a growing businessTeam focus, willing to learn and teach to drive towards a common goalAbility to think outside the box when analyzing data to find relationships/correlations that could enhance business needs and productivityThis position is based in the corporate office in Holtsville, NY.Job Type: Full-time

Position Purpose:

Under the direction and/or guidance of the Information Technology Manager, this position is responsible for the operation of the companys and subsidiaries Database systems. Will apply root cause operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities to keep services up and running meeting SLAs (OLAs). Provide automation solutions of manual tasks performed by infrastructure support. Develop solutions using available tools and technologies and assist in problem resolution by hands-on participation. Operate in complex, highly-secure, and highly-available, operations environments, and interact with technology experts (Vendor). Follow companys processes and methodologies.

Nature and Scope:

The Database Administrators role is to install, monitor, maintain, and performance tune production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability. This individual is also responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database policies and procedures to ensure the integrity and availability of databases and their accompanying software. Access to databases will be defined and controlled in conjunction with Information Protection Policies. All changes must adhere to Renown Health Change Management policies and procedures.
Additional responsibilities and overtime may be required.
Strategy & Planning
Assess and develop long-term strategic goals for production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers.
Design and implement redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.
Acquisition & Deployment
Conduct research and make recommendations on database products, services, protocols, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.
Operational Management
Install and configure relevant network components to ensure database access as well as database consistency and integrity.
Respond to and resolve database access and performance issues.
Monitor database system details within the database, including stored procedures and execution time, and implement efficiency improvements.
Monitor, optimize, and allocate physical data storage for database systems.
Plan and coordinate data migrations between systems.
Develop, implement, and maintain change control and testing processes for modifications to databases.
Perform database transaction and security audits.
Establish appropriate end-user database access control levels.
Develop routines for end users to facilitate best practices database use.
Manage and/or provide guidance to junior members of the team.
Personal Attributes
Good written and oral communication skills.
Strong technical documentation skills.
Good interpersonal skills.
Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards, and products as required.
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Strong customer service orientation.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
This position does not provide patient care.

The foregoing description is not intended and should not be construed to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills and efforts or work conditions associated with the job. It is intended to be an accurate reflection of the general nature and level of the job.

Minimum Qualifications: Requirements - Required and/or Preferred

Education:
Must have working-level knowledge of the English language, including reading, writing and speaking English. Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related fields will receive preference, but is not required.

Experience:
Minimum three years experience in clustering, mirroring, replication, scripting, stored procedures, functions, performance tuning, resource management and trouble shooting is required.
Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Working technical experience with designing, building, installing, configuring, and supporting database servers, including MS-SQL, or other databases is desirable.
Hands-on database tuning and troubleshooting experience.
Experience with data processing flowcharting techniques.
Project management experience.
Strong understanding of the organizations goals and objectives.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
Preference will be given to individuals with experience in hospital systems or multiple and cross platform database environments.

License(s):
None.

Certification(s):
None.

Computer / Typing:
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook,PowerPoint, Excel, Access and Word andhave the ability to use the computer to complete online learning requirements for job-specific competencies, access online forms and policies, complete online benefits enrollment, etc.

Overview: Nielsen Scarborough, the nation's premier source for local consumer insights through survey research, is looking for a skilled individual to join as a Database Analyst. This position involves heavy day-to-day data processing. The ideal candidate will thrive on working in a fast-paced production environment. The Database Analyst role requires strong numerical, logistical, and analytical skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Running Production processes and monitoring
Resolve database issues, queries and error reports in accurate and timely manner
Write SQL scripts, queries, stored procedures and functions for database systems
Perform quality assurance tests for ensuring data integrity and quality
Perform logistical summations on survey questions and their responses in relation to similar questions to determine proper alignment of data
Coordinate with team members to work with database tables based on project requirements
Test database systems and perform bug fixes
Update tables with logistical statements to connect data
Ensure that production deadlines are met, working closely within a team and other departments
Responsible for creation and support of final product for client delivery
Provide project updates and metrics to Manager on regular basis
Team with other Scarborough personnel on new development projects and assisting on existing projects as necessary
Create internal documentation for new processes and maintain documentation on existing processes
Participate in new software and hardware planning/implementation
Other duties as assigned by manager
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2+ years related experience
Strong working knowledge of Excel in particular working with macros
Programming experience in Visual FoxPro, MS SQL Server, MySQL, MS Access or similar platform required
Good understanding of data and schema standards and concepts
Detail oriented with strong numerical and analytical abilities to solve problems
Superior organizational, written and oral communication skills
Ability to prioritize workload from multiple departments
Ability to interact well within a team and to work independently
We believe a company is only as good as its people. Our goal is to create a diverse workplace where each team member is valued and respected. We offer a comprehensive employment package, including competitive compensation, excellent health care options, and 401K matching.
ABOUT NIELSEN
By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL, Uniontown, OH and London, Eng.

About the Role

As a Lead Database Administrator, you'll play a key role in developing our technology base and helping the company move forward to a more current technology stack. You'll be responsible for all aspects of database administration for our production and development database environments that support nearly 70+ million unique users a month (and growing). We currently have multiple production OLTP databases, a data warehouse and a half dozen staging and QA database servers.

Our DBA team focuses on creating, configuring and maintaining SQL Server and Postgres databases. In addition, they own our DR and HA strategies, and play an important part in setting the technology trends and standards we will be building upon in the future.

In this role you will work with a small, collaborative team of engineers and product managers – so good social and interpersonal skills are also a requirement. Most importantly, we're looking for an individual who can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver high-quality solutions.

Compensation: $144,000.00 - $180,000.00
At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.

At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:

Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)
Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)
Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller
cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)

You can learn more about our compensation philosophy here and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs here.
What You'll Do

As one of a team of 4, you'll need to be a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the needs arise. You love to tackle problems and take independent action, seek out new responsibilities, act on opportunities, and generate new ideas

What You'll Bring
7+ years SQL Server Database Administration
Currently working with SQL Server 2019 with AlwaysOn Availability Groups in high volume, high availability production database systems
Production experience with Postgres
Experience with Cassandra and MongoDB a huge plus
Extensive knowledge of AWS - EC2 and RDS are required
Experience with both Windows and Linux administration highly desired
Experienced at troubleshooting performance issues related to CPU, memory, I/O, disk space and other types of resource contention
Expertise in disaster recovery and high availability for SQL Server and Postgres
Knowledge of partitioning strategies and having worked with very large tables
Experience with PowerShell and/or other scripting languages highly preferred
A strong desire and ability to add to our culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion
Why Glassdoor?
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.
Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).
Annual 10% bonus aligning with bi-annual performance reviews.
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off.
Our Commitments
Transparency: We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback survey responses are shared publicly.
Innovation: We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
Good People: We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.
GRIT: We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. We also provide programs and resources to build a greater sense of belonging for our employees.
