The State of New Hampshire, Department of Information Technology, Operations Division - Database Administration has a full time vacancy for a Database Administrator / Technical Support Specialist VI.
Summary:
Directs, oversees, monitors, and coordinates the selection, installation, design, development, security, normalization, operation, processing, performance and maintenance of sophisticated relational DBMS (Oracle, DB2, e.g.) and/or other data storage and retrieval systems operated on micro, midframe, mainframe and client/server systems that are utilized by Department, cross functional, mission critical software applications. Evaluates, plans or integrates analysis of data to formulate current and long-range solutions, strategies or policies of a specialized or technical nature.
Responsibilities:

Selects and directs the implementation of systems performance tools to monitor performance.

Identifies, defines, designs, and constructs the software and hardware systems that will store and retrieve data from a variety of micro, midframe, mainframe, and client/server data base systems.
Controls, establishes, defines, and coordinates logical data elements, relationships, links, standards and physical structure of the data storage and retrieval system for various uses of the data retained.
Advises, directs, and negotiates with all department users and technical personnel and coordinates/facilitates communication between agencies to ensure efficient design and utilization of the database systems utilizing knowledge of the department programs, policies and goals and the ability to communicate and negotiate effectively with diverse groups with varying priorities.
Coordinates research efforts concerning analysis of suitability of new computer technology, and submits recommendations to agency management.
Identifies, designs, organizes, directs and monitors training programs and the dissemination of written procedures to initiate/maintain an effective orientation program for all Department software developers, network personnel, user management, non-state employees, and others. This will be necessary to ensure complete understanding of data stored in the database systems, to promote proper understanding of operations and improve the effectiveness of those using these systems.
Researches technical material, develops new solutions to problems, forecasts problems, and identifies solutions.
Creates triggers, writes stored procedures and implements comprehensive SQL language programs as necessary to support Department level ad-hoc requests for information, implementation of new or existing applications or extract of information to other data bases applications.
Researches, identifies the need for, designs detailed functional specifications, system specifications and implements software routines and manual procedures as necessary to ensure data integrity is verified and maintained at all times within the database.
Assigns, outlines, and supervises programming activities that affect the database including analysis, coding, testing, debugging, operation, implementation, and documentation.
Oversees, monitors, directs and performs the creation and modification of computer programs, JCL streams, and documentation for the creation and maintenance of the department applications.
Directs, designs, and implements recovery and backup activities to ensure data integrity and system/database recoverability.
Accesses the Internet to secure software patches, updates, enhancements, product information, documentation, user bulletin boards and shared information forums with other DBMS users.
Provides guidance, advice for, and directs capacity planning efforts on the various hardware platforms.
Provides detailed estimates of time and resources required utilizing state of the art project planning software as necessary to perform software/database developments and maintenance tasks.
Reviews and evaluates work of teams and individuals, prepares and presents task, project and individual performance reports.
Directs, designs, and implements database security as necessary to ensure confidentiality of Department and client information and to ensure the integrity of the database and to provide protection against felonious access and disbursement of information utilizing knowledge of automated security systems, information security principals, agency operation and confidentiality requirements.
Reviews changes to User policies and procedures, and plans systems modifications accordingly.
Provides guidance, advice and direction to subordinates; demonstrates in-depth understanding of all database and related client server programming concepts, including flowcharting, data flow diagramming, entry relationship diagramming, requirements definition, system and software analysis, coding, debugging, testing, documenting, and implementing programs and systems.
Assigns work, monitors performance, and evaluates results of assigned team members, teams and projects.
Designs, directs, monitors, controls and operates mainframe and client/server database performance monitoring software, hardware and other tools as necessary, generating detail and high level management reporting to teach, train, advise and direct changes as necessary to applications, networks, hardware, software, and/or database structure to ensure optimal data accessibility.
Develops, documents, generates, and presents to administrators, technical staff, contractors and other outside entities performance, security and other important information forecasting the changes that will take place in any and all aspects of the database and information retrieval needs of the department based, as to allow the Department/agencies adequate lead time to secure funding, plan and implement needed changes. This process will be performed based upon statistical sampling, performance trend analysis and detailed knowledge of the operation and performance of the database systems under the control of this position.
Creates and maintains a data dictionary of all elements in the database systems that will include but not be limited to, data field definition documentation of source, utilization, range, domain, security needs and other important data element information.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:


Education : Bachelor's degree from a recognized college or university with a major study in mathematics, computer science, business administration or a related degree field with at least fifteen (15) credit hours in the field of computer science. Each additional year of approved formal education may be substituted for one year of required work experience.
Experience : Eight years' experience in computer networking and systems operations, three years of which shall have been concerned with designing and maintaining computer networks and providing technical support in a multi-platform environment. Each additional year of approved work experience may be substituted for one year of required formal education.
License/Certification : Must be eligible to hold a valid New Hampshire driver's license and have access to transportation for use in statewide travel.
DISCLAIMER STATEMENT : The supplemental job description lists the essential functions of the position and is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to a position. An employee may be required to perform other related duties not listed on the supplemental job description provided that such duties are characteristic of that classification.

For further information please contact Susan Weeks, IT Manager (603) 230-3415

Selected candidate will undergo a fingerprint-based criminal background check and motor vehicle record check in order to ensure suitability for exposure to confidential information.

CSUN strives to be a destination workplace, where everyone understands that they belong to a community that is vital in advancing student success and providing exemplary service to all stakeholders. We foster an environment of success, both for our students and our employees. We have a relentless passion for celebrating diversity, equity, and inclusion as well as being an employer of choice. You will also have the opportunity to realize your own personal goals and be recognized for the work you do, and enjoy the unique value the CSUN community can offer. If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the right place. Learn more: https://www.csun.edu/about-csun.

Major Duties
Under general supervision of the Director of Marketing and Engagement, the Database Associate directly oversees all patron databases utilized by The Soraya, including the YSNC ticketing database and YSNC data in the Development database, Raisers Edge. The incumbent maintains audience information such as contact information, ticket buying and donation history, and more.

Ensures all data is kept up to date and frequently “cleans” data to ensure accuracy and oversees coordination of data transfers between databases as needed.

Independently completes complex quantitative analysis and generates standard reports that aggregate key information and directly informs strategic decisions made by the development and marketing staff.

Supports Director of Marketing and Engagement and Director of Development through the research, collection, and presentation of data.

Performs other duties as assigned.
NOTE: To view the full position description including all of the required qualifications copy and paste this link into your browser: https://bit.ly/2VgNrqq

Qualifications
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in a job-related field.
Equivalent to three (3) years of full-time, progressively responsible technical, analytical, or administrative experience.

Additional experience in job-related field may be substituted for up to two years of the required education, on a year for year basis.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Working knowledge of general practices, program, and/or administrative specialty and working knowledge of operational analysis and techniques. Thorough knowledge of data analytics.
Ability and specialized skills to expertly investigate and analyze problems with a broad administrative impact and implications.

Ability to: oversee and/or train others and provide lead work direction; interpret, and apply a wide variety of policies and procedures to develop conclusions and make recommendations; compile, write and present reports related to program or administrative specialty; and communicate clearly and effectively both orally and in writing.
Proficiency and extensive knowledge of patron management databases preferred, as well as excellent quantitative analysis skills.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
The university offers an excellent benefits package, including but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, retirement & savings, tuition waiver and more.

Transforming Lives

The Department of Information Technology has an exciting opportunity for a Full-time Senior Database Administrator to work remote. The Senior Database Administrator designs, implements, and maintains complex databases, including back-up, performance tuning, capacity planning, monitoring critical events, and documentation to ensure optimum system performance and efficiency.
Creates ad-hoc reports utilizing various data sources.
Develops data models and performs planning of architecture, functions, modules, recovery, standards, and implementation.
Provides primary support for the daily operations of database systems and serves as liaison to customs.
Plans, coordinates, and administers database systems including base definition, structure, documentation, requirements, and operational guidelines and protection.
Works on a variety of development and maintenance projects.
Works closely with developers and business users on system requirements, analysis, design, and implementation.
Provides guidance to technical staff on concepts and best practices.
Provides strategic advice on architecture and technology of database design, use, and administration.
Participates in the testing and implementation of new or enhanced database systems.
Establishes and maintains databases for user testing purposes and production.
Analyzes and determines information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements, and data output and reporting capabilities.
Researches and evaluates alternatives and recommends solutions for business issues.
This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.
CORE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field
Minimum 6 years of relevant experience
Knowledge of business and management principles.
Ability to direct, manage, implement, and evaluate department operations.
Ability to establish department goals, and objectives that support the strategic plan.
Ability to effectively plan, delegate and/or supervise the work of others.
Ability to lead, motivate, develop, and train others.
Any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience and/or certifications may be considered.
The University of Miami offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, tuition remission and more.
UHealth-University of Miami Health System, South Florida's only university-based health system, provides leading-edge patient care powered by the ground breaking research and medical education at the Miller School of Medicine. As an academic medical center, we are proud to serve South Florida, Latin America and the Caribbean. Our physicians represent more than 100 specialties and sub-specialties, and have more than one million patient encounters each year. Our tradition of excellence has earned worldwide recognition for outstanding teaching, research and patient care. We're the challenge you've been looking for.
Patient safety is a top priority. Failure to meet this requirement will result in rescinding or termination of employment.

If you reside in the DC metro area and are seeking a telecommuting position, look no further. ASRC Federal Data Networks is looking for a new member for our Application and Reporting teams that supports the Energy Compensation System (ECS) for the Division of Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation (DEEOIC) at the US Department of Labor (DOL). The position is on site at the DOL facility at 3rd and Constitution in Washington DC and is conveniently located near the Judiciary Square Metro station. This is a full time DBA/SQL Developer position with emphasis on SQL Server Knowledge.

The selected candidate will perform the following:

Has overall responsibility of the design and implementation of the back end server solution for DEEOIC.
Will provide day to day support for Application and Reporting teams.
Will provide database support during development and maintenance in all of the DEEOIC different environments (development, integration, testing, and production).
Will proactively generate relevant ideas for new and improved use of technology, and must understand the impacts of new projects and technical impacts to the supported system.
Will be proficient at database design and modeling, and work with the government IT data lead and support contractors to create a comprehensive database design documentation and schemes.
Must be able to work with other development teams to help design, implement new database changes or designs.
Will contribute, write, and maintain DB scripts for system DB maintenance.
Must have the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
Demonstrate the ability to translate customer requirements into solutions.
Strong knowledge of SQL and dialect of SQL used for IBM DB2, T-SQL for Microsoft SQL server. Experience with an Agile Scrum development methodology is a plus.
Evaluate and recommend relational database structures, monitor and recommend tuning strategies for specific databases like SQL Server or My SQL database environments for improved system performance.
Provide guidance and assistance in the development, maintenance, administration and enforcement of database management standards and guidelines.
Participate in walkthrough with development staff and conduct DBA training and presentations.
Analyze database requirements
Review physical data models for design integrity and adherence to standards
Make recommendations for, and implement underlining storage and security structures
Review and approve application based scripts, utilities, stored procedures, functions and triggers.
Develop and execute appropriate Data Definition Language (DDL) to support the project
Provide query performance monitoring and tuning recommendations.
Provide input on database and environment parameter settings and tuning.
Provide general database expertise to application developers.
Responsible for database capacity planning for adequate database storage.
Insure change management and documentation for database changes
Will serve as the lead for the Data Engineering team and be responsible for the team’s performance and reporting weekly status.
Must perform on demand and scheduled DB replication and refreshing tasks.
Must maintain User accounts and Security policy and update as needed.
Must monitor DB and Server performance and resolve issues as needed.
Must provide recommendation for DB sanitization.
Must re-architect the application to reporting flow such that PowerBI can truly be utilized
Provide support to external DBAs
Telecommuting available for this position. We also offer an excellent salary and benefits package that includes money set aside for professional development, a matching 401k with immediate vesting and a culture that fosters a family-work life balance, respect, and recognition. You are a passionate Database Administrator - You understand that effective solution development requires going above and beyond. You take pride in making a lasting impression. Your current position has limitations, and you seek a bigger job with a bigger impact. Your job search has many options, but you want to distinguish the jobs from the true career opportunities… which one is truly going to allow you to shine?
The role of senior database administrator has two key aspects: technological and customer-service leadership. The senior database administrator also provides leadership, technical guidance, training, and mentoring to others in areas of acquired expertise. The candidate is responsible for the efficient application of currently relevant and appropriate emerging technology in the development of quality products within the constraints of time and budget.
This position is Remote but reserved for the Eastern and Central US time zones.
Responsibilities
Design and collaborate on designs of new database platforms.
Write and review code associated with database queries and automation.
Optimize query and database performance.
Install, configure, patch, upgrade, backup, and monitor databases and database servers.
Respond to problems and changes with the highest degree of complexity and risk.
Find and remediate problems all the way down to root-cause through tenacity and cross-team collaboration and solutioning.
Drive adherence to Incident, Change, and Problem Management process.
Drive standardization.
Create and enable appropriate documentation of systems, processes, recovery, and troubleshooting.
Mentor other associates and model collaborative, customer-centric professionalism.
Learn new features and new platforms continuously, to enable and lead change.
Automate install, configure, scale up/down, backup/recovery, disaster recovery, and monitoring.
Develop processes and automation to manage the databases.
Provide off-hour assistance and support during critical outage situations.
Participate in a 24 x 7 on call rotation.
Qualifications
Requires a minimum of an associate degree in a technology related field with at least 5 years of professional experience providing database administration.
Strong database administration experience in Oracle, with minium 5 years experience.
Experience working on cross functional teams, multitasking, and managing time independently with little direction.
Strong leadership in collaboration, customer-service, communication, documentation, and team enablement.
Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills with particular focus on automation.
Experience with NOSQL databases like Cassandra or CouchDB is a plus.
Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills with particular focus on automation.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Experience in CI/CD automation a plus.
Experience with managing database systems in the Cloud is a plus.
Provide off-hour assistance and support during critical outage situations.
Participate in a 24 x 7 on call rotation.

Job Summary:
Responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of the Oracle database(s) to include Peoplesoft administration and related activities. Ensures the integrity, performance and availability of the database for optimal storage and retrieval. Managing Linux databases running under Real Application Cluster (RAC).
Work Schedule: Remote work available. Will be required to come to in person meetings when needed.

Job Duties:
Ensures sound database definitions, structures and documentation to include operations manual, system recovery strategies, system data flow diagrams, database architecture, user security and other similar post-deployment documentation.
Designs security and integrity controls.
Maintains and monitors the Oracle database environment(s).
Designs and analyzes policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
Provides technical advice and recommendations to departments requesting specialized support or services.
Performs all other duties as assigned.

Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering is required.
Experience:
Five (5) years of industry experience as an Oracle DBA is required.

Preferred:
Experience with Peoplesoft, Linux, ASM, RAC, current storage technologies, and VMware.

This position is a senior role within the database administration team. This position requires total proficiency in all aspects of database administration and design. This position is expected to mentor and oversee junior members of staff and will work closely with the development teams to provide high-quality business solutions and play an active role in projects from inception to delivery.


QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of DBA experience
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required

TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Strong interpersonal skills.
Strong understanding of database infrastructure, maintenance, administration, and design.
Ability to complete root cause analysis on database-related issues.
Ability to complete impact analysis on database-related issues.
Strong problem-solving skills in multiple operating environments.
Strong organizational skills.
Proven ability to troubleshoot connectivity and performance issues that involve database infrastructure.
Ability to complete database infrastructure installations.
Ability to research new or alternative database technologies.
Good oral and written communication skills.

ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Resolve performance issues and root cause resolution.
Ensure clear and early communication, in particular ensuring that the line manager and/or relevant parties are kept informed of progress, issues, and difficulties.
Train junior-level DBA staff as necessary, ensuring they are up to speed on critical processes and technologies.
Lead research into new or alternative technologies.
Review and sign off recommendations for upgrades or changes to the back-office infrastructure environment.
Engage with Technical Architects and other senior members of Development teams to provide technical designs and guidance to the Database Operations team, taking responsibility for the implications and impact of their design decisions.
Responsible for maintenance and “bug fix” activities for existing database infrastructure and equipment.
Undertake research into new or alternative technologies and make recommendations for upgrades or changes to the database infrastructure environment.
Responsible for installation of new database infrastructure and equipment and monitoring its stability.
Undertake thorough impact analysis of all assigned database infrastructure activities and understand the impact of work on database infrastructure systems and the business.
Respond to issues and support calls in-line with relevant procedures, including security.
Perform tests of upgrades and new database infrastructure and equipment.
Monitor database operations and support maintenance activities efficiently in order to ensure minimal issues and incidents.
Install new or upgrade database infrastructure equipment.
All other duties as assigned.

Job Title: SAP Platform – Senior HANA Database Administrator
Description:
Who We Are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world's most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We're looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
Who We're Looking For
Toyota's ITx/DCX-Finance, Accounting, Procurement Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated SAP Platform – Senior HANA Database Administrator.
The primary responsibility of this role is to focus on design, implement and maintain a strategic view of TMNA's HANA database modeling, responsible for maintaining the HANA roadmap. The successful candidate must have experience monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting SAP HANA systems, implementing SAP HANA Table management techniques - data compression, table partition, compression techniques, and load/unload table into memory. A HANA system administration using SAP HANA Cockpit and HANA Studio and experience with high availability and the backup mechanism is also required for this position.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, ITX EO - SAP Platform, the person in this role will work closely with the ERP Delivery team and support activities of Toyota North America's various SAP initiatives. This role will engage closely with the ERP Experience team, ERP Delivery team, Functional Process Owners, Design Leads, and COE to efficiently receive knowledge from the implementation team and support critical business activities.
What You'll Be DoingMaintain the overall health of S/4Hana databases, responsible for database monitoring, backup, and restore activities, performing failover scenarios, and optimizing the database costs.
Collaborating regularly with SAP basis team members and other areas delivering value across the enterprise, managing technical debt, and maximizing technical investment in SAP.
Being highly reliable for complex enterprise system environments.
Understand the overall SAP enterprise system landscape and can perceive functional requirements between SAP components within the core ERP solution being deployed as well as integrate to Non-SAP applications in the enterprise environment.
Involved in all phases of the life cycle implementation, including blueprinting, mapping, prototype, design, configuration, testing, go-live, user training, and post-release support.
Design, implement and maintain a strategic view of TMNA's HANA database modeling, responsible for maintaining the HANA roadmap. Experience in monitoring, tuning, and troubleshooting SAP HANA systems. Implementing SAP HANA Table management techniques - data compression, table partition, compression techniques, and load/unload table into memory. HANA system administration using SAP HANA Cockpit and HANA Studio. Experience with high availability and backup mechanism.
Strategic planning for continuous improvement and upgrading of the SAP platform. Enhance SAP efficiency, stability, security, and reduce total cost of ownership. Develop a vision to monitor data growth and suggest database level efficiencies.
Lead in all phases of the HANA DB upgrades, including POC, blueprinting, mapping, design, configuration, testing, go-live, and support.
Create and maintain standard operating procedures and guidelines. Create/follow up on problem reports, root cause analysis in case of any outages.
What You Bring
Experience in SAP HANA database administration, hosting, problem-solving, managing data growth proactively.

Experience in HANA DB version upgrades, patching, supporting license audits.
Experience in operational excellence - Sets up alerts and checks to detect potential problems creeping up and use knowledge and skills to prevent them from happening.
Experience in HANA Installation, Data Provisioning, ongoing tuning of HANA systems.
Experience with troubleshooting and debugging complex integrated applications.
Experience in full cycle implementations (prior experience in defining/implementing worldwide solutions across multiple legal entities in highly complex systems and project environments) serving as Hana administrator lead.
Must have excellent verbal and written communications skills to work across teams to develop and implement complex projects.
Added Bonus If You HaveBachelor's degree.
HANA 2.0 experience.
Ability to work with large distributed teams with diverse competencies, skills, and abilities.
Ability to work under pressure.
Experience implementing systems using any of the Agile methodologies.
Experience in full life cycle implementations (prior experience in defining/implementing worldwide solutions across multiple legal entities in highly complex systems and project environments) serving as lead PO/PI lead.
Experience in working in an onshore/offshore model.
Strong business process knowledge and association of processes to technical areas in SAP is desired.
Ansible scripting is a plus.
What We'll Bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Vehicle purchase & lease programs.

Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.
Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable).
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off.
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more.
Flexible spending accounts.
Relocation assistance (if applicable).
Belonging At Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members' efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc's Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.
Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics.
Have a question or need assistance with your application? Check out the How to Apply section of our careers page on Toyota.com.
To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

Position Title: Data Services Manager - DBAFLSA Status:  ExemptDepartment Name: Professional Services - MDMReports to: Professional ServicesLocation:  Tampa, FL (required, not remote)Primary Purpose and Function:Syft is a leading provider of Supply Chain Automation and Analytics solutions to US hospitals. Syft has been in business over 21 years, is private equity backed and has a long list of prestigious clients to its credit. Syft has 85 employees based in the Tampa, FL office and a similar number of technical employees in its Hyderabad, India office. Syft is seeking to add a Data Services Manager - DBA supporting its Master Data Management (MDM) Data Services offering.A Data Services Manager - DBA is responsible for project planning, production, delivery and client management activities related to Syft’s MDM Data Services offering.The primary elements of this role include:1. Project Management – Ensure the successful delivery of MDM Data Services projects, on-time and within scope guidelines. Client management is a key element to this role, to manage expectations, lead technical discussions to assist necessary client decision points, and to provide on-going project status updates.2. This is a Technical Role - The Data Services Project Manager is expected to participate in data analysis activities and delivery review prior to client delivery. It is common for the Data Services Project Manager to provide hands-on data analysis and data manipulation support to assist project execution and success.3. MDM Production Coordination – Convey and confirm project technical and schedule requirements with MDM Production Team Leads. Periodically monitor production efforts and production results to ensure compliance with requirements. Identify potential technical or quality gaps early, permitting recovery and process adjustments.4. Risk Management – Recognize technical and schedule risks as early as possible, identify root causes and recommend corrective actions. Early identification permits a coordinated review and response by Syft and/or the Client. Internal or external escalation is expected as needed and as appropriate to the issue.5. Implementation Coordination – MDM Projects delivered in coordination with Syft’s Professional Services Implementation team are common. The Data Services Project Manager will provide necessary project planning guidance, risk identification and coordination with the Syft Program Manager.6. Process Improvement and Automation. The Data Services Project Manager will provide on-going production process improvement guidance and identify production automation opportunities as possible.Essential Functions and Responsibilities:· Direct day-to-day MDM Data Services project management, project planning, delivery and reporting for multiple projects· Client Management, ensuring success, managing expectations and risk· Coordinate MDM production activities and deliveries with Syft’s Professional Services and Implementation Teams· Identify and assist to develop and implement production process improvement and automation strategies· Provide MDM Pre-Sales Support, Presentation, Project Scoping and Proposal PreparationKnowledge, Skills and Experience Needed for the Job:· Familiarity with Hospital Supply chain management analysis, concepts and challenges - required· Extensive project management and client-facing experience - required· Demonstrated understanding of MDM principles and delivery strategies - required· Effective written and verbal communications skills - required· Competent hands-on database skills (i.e., SQL, MSAccess, Visual Basic for Applications, etc.) - preferred· Clinical products & manufacturer domain expertise - preferred· Familiarity or experience with the common Healthcare ERPs - desiredPhysical Demands:· Position will work out of the Syft Tampa, Florida office (required)· Occasional travel to client and prospect sites, usually in the pre-sales phase, as requiredCompany Policy/Procedure Compliance:The Data Services Manager - DBA will be obligated to comply with all company policies and procedures including, but not limited to any Customer Business Associate Agreements that the company may enter into, in addition to complying with other Human Resources requirements. In discharging the duties of this position, the Data Services Manager - DBA may come into contact with confidential patient identifiable electronic health information and will be obligated to maintain the confidentiality of this information and report any breach immediately to the proper hospital authorities.Job Context and Other Relevant Information:The Data Services Manager - DBA has a direct responsibility to ensure the safety of Syft’s brand portfolio. The Data Services Manager - DBA will maintain the highest ethical standards possible in building and protecting brand equity.Compensation and Company BenefitsSyft offers a competitive salary for this position. In addition, we offer a complete employee benefits package including company sponsored major medical and prescription program, dental, vision, life insurance and disability plans. In addition, we offer paid time off (PTO), paid holidays and supplemental insurance programs. We also provide a 401k retirement program with a company match.Equal Opportunity Employment: At Syft we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.Syft is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.Job Type: Full-timePay: $70,889.00 - $182,137.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Tampa, FL 33610: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Hospital Supply chain management analysis: 3 years (Preferred)SQL: 3 years (Preferred)common Healthcare ERPs: 3 years (Preferred)License/Certification:PMP (Preferred)Work Location: One location

Who provides the know-how to protect data, tools and information systems at Dell Technologies? It’s the Database Admin team within our Information Technology organization. We develop, design and optimize our information technology and systems functions that support our business processes and technical information systems platforms. Focused on efficiency, performance, availability and platform compatibility, we analyze, select and modify enterprise systems and application software, install network hardware and software and manage our databases – setting system and programming standards along the way.
Join us as a Consultant Data Base Administrator on our Database Design Engineering and Reliability Enablement team in Remote, Texas to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
As a Consultant Database Administrator you will be responsible for Providing technical consultations and Database Solutions, Database Platform Reliability Services which includes DB Provision and Support. You will work with Application Team, DB Engineering, DDC team onNo SQL Databases, Graph Databases ( Tiger Graph, Neo4j, Cassandra), and RDBMS like Oracle.
You will:
Work with internal customers (i.e., Product Managers, Project Managers, and technical users from the Application team) to complete Database Provision in time.
Upgrading DB Server/Applying Service Packs as needed, Server Replication Designing and Implement
 Server and Database Security Administration, Tune database queries, tuning and Monitoring
 Create database objects (tables, indexes, etc.) and Write database procedures, functions, and triggers
Works with Application Team, DB Engineering, DDC team, and DB Cross Product Lead to define and deliver requested products
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
At least 12 years of experience in No SQL, Graph Database and Oracle Administration in a big Enterprise organization
Extensive experience in designing and handling Disaster recovery/high availability/
Should be very strong in replication concepts and troubleshooting replication issues within SLA.
Good communication, time management, negotiation, and leadership skills
Masters or Bachelor's degree in any discipline
Desirable Requirements
Experience in scripting tools: PowerShell, Perl, Python, Shell, etc
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems
Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service

Overview: Nielsen Scarborough, the nation's premier source for local consumer insights through survey research, is looking for a skilled individual to join as a Database Analyst. This position involves heavy day-to-day data processing. The ideal candidate will thrive on working in a fast-paced production environment. The Database Analyst role requires strong numerical, logistical, and analytical skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Running Production processes and monitoring
Resolve database issues, queries and error reports in accurate and timely manner
Write SQL scripts, queries, stored procedures and functions for database systems
Perform quality assurance tests for ensuring data integrity and quality
Perform logistical summations on survey questions and their responses in relation to similar questions to determine proper alignment of data
Coordinate with team members to work with database tables based on project requirements
Test database systems and perform bug fixes
Update tables with logistical statements to connect data
Ensure that production deadlines are met, working closely within a team and other departments
Responsible for creation and support of final product for client delivery
Provide project updates and metrics to Manager on regular basis
Team with other Scarborough personnel on new development projects and assisting on existing projects as necessary
Create internal documentation for new processes and maintain documentation on existing processes
Participate in new software and hardware planning/implementation
Other duties as assigned by manager
Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2+ years related experience
Strong working knowledge of Excel in particular working with macros
Programming experience in Visual FoxPro, MS SQL Server, MySQL, MS Access or similar platform required
Good understanding of data and schema standards and concepts
Detail oriented with strong numerical and analytical abilities to solve problems
Superior organizational, written and oral communication skills
Ability to prioritize workload from multiple departments
Ability to interact well within a team and to work independently
We believe a company is only as good as its people. Our goal is to create a diverse workplace where each team member is valued and respected. We offer a comprehensive employment package, including competitive compensation, excellent health care options, and 401K matching.
ABOUT NIELSEN
By connecting clients to audiences, we fuel the media industry with the most accurate understanding of what people listen to and watch. To discover what audiences love, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are truly connected to their audiences, they can see the most important opportunities and accelerate growth.
Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!
Nielsen is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Scope and Purpose of Position

The role of the Database Analyst is to develop automated and scalable reporting capabilities for internal and external customers. This includes the development, design and maintenance of reporting capabilities utilizing SQL programming and ETL tools available within the business.

Essential Functions


Development of standardized SQL queries and stored procedures across multiple disparate servers/databases
Development of ETL processes utilizing Informatica Power Center and/or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Creation of new claim reports for clients showing submission volumes, dollar amounts, client/state acceptance percentages and rejection volumes by reason code
Creation of reconciliation controls and reporting to ensure data submissions align with core system counts as well as responses from states and clients for file/data completeness
Ensure the timely and accurate generation of internal/external reporting, consistency and standardization amongst the various types of reports and databases and manage the various reporting tools utilized by Versant Health
Active participation in the development of data warehouse’s, data stores and other supplemental reporting enhancements, including the creation of new reporting templates and analytical reports, maintain a reporting schedule and documentation of reporting procedures
Collaborate with internal departments and external entities to identify and implement changes that will enhance core system data quality
Analyze, interpret and report financial and operational performance trends from various channels & departments, identifying areas performing outside of expected results
Develop efficiencies to consolidate and increase the effectiveness of outbound file development and reconciliation, and maintain departmental reports used internally and externally
Maintain current knowledge of regulations, data files, and their structures and associated database tables in the IT systems
Meet all time sensitive outbound file and data delivery dates
Interact with Client Management and Clients directly to discuss reporting requirements and deliver reporting results
Perform ad hoc duties in accordance with business needs

Education and Experience


Preferred Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent combination of experience and education
5+ years SQL development experience; advance SQL skills required
3+ years’ ETL development experience using Informatica PowerCenter and/or SSIS
Experience within health care industry and knowledge of claims data highly desirable
Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel, Access and/or other data analysis reporting tools
Preferred experience with application logic with an ability to read/develop programs and review the logic of programs developed by others as well as to read file layouts
Ability to work onsite and participate in interactive onsite meetings on a regular and predictable basis
Ability to initiate immediate interaction, coordination and collaboration with team members, clients, customers etc.

HIPAA & Security Requirements
All Associates must comply with the Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) as it pertains to disclosures of protected health information (PHI) as described in the Notice of Privacy Practices and HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures. As a component of job roles and responsibilities, Associates may have access to covered information, cardholder data or other confidential customer information which must be protected at all times. As a result, Associates must explicitly adhere to all data security guidelines established within the Company’s Privacy & Security Training Program.

We take pride in our recruiting process and follow a merit-based employee recruitment practice with extensive screening steps. We will never request money from candidates who seek employment with us and will never ask for any payment as part of the recruitment process.

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious beliefs, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), national origin, ancestry, status as a protected veteran or disabled veteran, physical or mental disability or history of disability, genetic information, marital status, or any and all other categories protected by under applicable Federal, state or local law.

This policy extends to all associates and to all aspects of the employment relationship. Any associate who violates this policy will be subject to disciplinary action up to and including termination.

Company Information
PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business.
Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!
Requisition Summary
PACCAR is a global truck technology leader with operations around the world. The Digital Solutions team is helping PACCAR make better decisions faster by moving to the cloud, adopting DevOps/CICD best practices, and unlocking a new level of productivity & value. We are looking for technology leaders to drive this evolution.
We are looking for an experienced Database Administrator of Oracle and PostgreSQL databases with an ability to manage hundreds enterprise level databases in a scalable database solution. The ideal candidate is enthusiastic about learning new technologies and implementing solutions using these technologies to empower internal customers and scale the existing platform. The ideal candidate demonstrates solid business and communication skills and ability to work with business and technical teams. In this role, you will serve as the expert at designing, implementing, and maintaining stable, scalable, low cost database solutions. The Database Administrator will design, develop, implement, test, document, and operate large-scale, high-volume, high-performance database structures. Implement data structures using best practices in data modeling. Will perform tasks such as PostgreSQL installations, database backups and restores, database creation, refreshes, application of DB patches, review of DB for performance enhancements and monitoring for availability are performed regularly. He/she will be tuning performance on queries running over millions of rows of data. The person in this position should be analytical, have an extremely high level of customer focus and a passion for process improvement. The Database Administrator should be motivated self-starter that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment and should have excellent business acumen and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions.
Job Functions / Responsibilities
Experience in a complex Oracle database environment.
Administration, configuration and installation of PostgreSQL Databases
Assist developers with debugging and tuning of Oracle Stored Procedures and batch Oracle programs.
Design, implement, and support Oracle databases in online transaction and batch environments.
Ability to tune ORACLE queries using EXPLAIN.
Generate scripts to migrate ORACLE schema changes between environments using ORACLE admin tools.
Familiar with DevOps methodology to automate database deployment.
Experience with ORACLE native SQL procedures.
Develop simple and complex Postgres stored procedures, functions and views to meet enhancement requirements.
Good understanding of relational data modeling including physical database design using ERWin data modeler or other similar tool.
Provide database support estimate for new projects.
Develop ETL strategies for integrating data from multiple sources in data warehouses
Adhere to and enforce database standards.
Introduce and deploy new database features.
Ensure security is integrated into all data solutions to meet compliance standards.
Performing PostgreSQL, Oracle and MySQL DB patching, investigate and remediate vulnerabilities
Perform onsite database recovery/restore as required.
Experience with Disaster Recovery procedure and validation.
Support ORACLE and Postgres database upgrades.
Design, develop, and migrate Oracle on AIX to Oracle on Linux.
Assist Data Engineer in moving data from Oracle to distributed systems using an ETL tool, such as Attunity.
Qualifications & Skills
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years relevant experience as an ORACLE DBA in a z/OS environment using Oracle utilities, including experience with Linux, evaluating dump output, is required.
Proven database design and development experience in an AIX and Linux environment is required (preferably including ORACLE).
Oracle DBA experience in an online environment is desirable.
Working knowledge in both UNIX and windows platforms including cross-platform data access is desirable.
Experience with ORACLE stored procedures, Erwin are all pluses.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in PostgreSQL Server or equivalent database administration, patch management, maintenance of Replication/DR Environment and performance tuning.
Expertise with SQL and relational database systems.
PostgreSQL, Oracle and/or MySQL experience or certification
Proven experience with integrations from oracle to Postgres
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts.
Knowledge of data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
Knowledge of modeling logical/business data requirements in a data model tool, such as ERWin data modeler.
Ability to support multiple RDBMS technologies and work in the AWS cloud environment is a plus.
Experience in generating scripts for physical database deployment.
Ability to teach data modeling and data design concept to IT and business people.
Familiarity with Cloud, NoSQL, and Hadoop data technologies.
Familiarity with dimensional and data vault modeling techniques.
Knowledge of more than one database platform, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle and Teradata.
Knowledge of standard data model reports.
Must have knowledge of data normalization and denormalization techniques.
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, including active listening, problem solving when under pressure, and facilitation.
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
New technologies are desired, such as Python scripting language and C#.
Amazon AWS experience is desired
Education
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
Work Setting
Prolonged sitting and manual dexterity are required. This position is in an office/desk work setting.

Named one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies in the World in 2021, Marqeta powers innovative payment solutions for many of the apps and services you enjoy daily. Our open API modern card issuing platform provides unprecedented flexibility and control for industry-leading companies such as Square, Coinbase, J.P.Morgan, and Uber, to issue cards, authorize transactions and manage payment operations in real-time.

We are a team of industry experts and technology innovators who take a dynamic approach to solving challenging problems. Marqeta is certified as a 2021-2022 Fortune Great Place to Work, highlighting our company culture and open and collaborative work environment. We power possibilities for our customers and each other by bringing the brightest talent together to do the best work of our lives.

Marqeta strives to build a global team as diverse as the markets we serve, staying true to our values: Connect the Customer, Everyone Belongs, Marqeta Cares, Lead Innovation, Deliver Results, Quality First and Build One Marqeta. We are not expecting any single candidate to meet all job requirements listed below, so please apply. It's an exciting time to join Marqeta. As we grow, your career and opportunities will grow as well. Learn more about Marqeta on our Website, Twitter and LinkedIn
Position Summary

As a Cloud Database Engineer, you will help us scale the technology as our business continues to grow. You will help to innovate on various aspects of the platform used by our engineering organization to deliver high quality, highly scalable, and highly secure products to our customers

What You'll Do

As a Cloud Database Engineer, you would help:

Build and drive the technical vision for database design, administration, maintenance, migration of the MySQL, PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases used across Marqeta.
Design the high availability database architecture, and implementation efforts for migrating databases to AWS Cloud infrastructure.
Design platform architecture, security model, backup and recovery strategy, disaster planning and solutions and overall documentation and periodic review of database standards, procedures and metadata.
Define automation goals of the DBA organization. Review of the repeatable mundane activities which the team performs on a periodic basis. Identify low hanging fruit and provide the strategy or tools that would meet the automation needs.
Keep automation as the primary focus and ensure the design is tightly coupled with various automations to reduce the manual work.
Provide guidance on capacity needs including but not limited to Storage, CPU and memory forecasting, automation solution, disaster recovery and planning solutions.
Lead the root cause analysis, remediation and document efforts to effectively minimize P1 incidents.
What We're Looking For
Strong experience in Cloud infrastructure. We use AWS but welcome experience in other Cloud environments.
Expert database administrator supporting complex legacy, vendor-based OLTP databases & modern database platforms including open source and cloud.
We use MySQL, PostGreSQL, MongoDB but welcome experience in different RDBMS systems.
Expert in automation and orchestration platforms (Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation, etc.). Hands on experience designing and developing infrastructure and Database automation.
Strong communication skills, ability to work independently and effectively with clients and IT managers. Ability to self-drive initiatives for the database organization that spans across the enterprise.
Team-oriented approach – can effectively lead a project as well as work cross-functionally with other organizations.
Nice-to-haves
AWS Certification(s)
Any experience with scaling large, transactional systems and data shading would be welcome.
Production Experience with modern engineering, monitoring and cloud tools
Benefits and Perks
Rich suite of benefit plans; employee premiums paid 100%
Flexible Time Off
Paid Medical, Pregnancy, Parental and Family Leaves
401k plan with a Company match
Competitive pay
Meaningful equity
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Free perks programs that include, financial coaching, and ID theft protection
Bi-annual "Hack Week" to support and reward innovation
Open, transparent culture that includes Town Hall meetings, Lunch-and-Learns and more!
Access to corporate gym membership rates, other discounts and employee perks
And for select regions; a monthly stipend to support our hybrid work model, and pet insurance

SQL and Azure Database AdministratorPROGRAM OVERVIEW The Division of Information Technology aims to align technology solutions with the DOHMH mission by prioritizing resource use and deploying innovations that facilitate the agency’s day-to-day activities and enhance staff productivity and efficiency. DOHMH uses various systems for disease surveillance, and the COVID response has put a large strain on epidemiologist teams. In order to streamline operations and make workflows more efficient, enhancements to the surveillance systems are needed to support the response to COVID-19 and future pandemics. This includes: Electronic Disease Reporting Infrastructure (EDRI,) Electronic Clinical Reporting System (ECLRS,) Secure Informatics Management Platform (SIMPL) and Universal Public Health Network (UPHN.) These are all integral components of the disease surveillance technical eco-system and will ensure that all COVID-19 providers and laboratory reports are appropriately processes, cleaned, matched and integrated with DOHMH’s outbreak management systems. These systems integrate with the City-wide Immunization Registry as well as with the Public Health Laboratory data warehouse. DOHMH users that require application support include epidemiologists, data analysts, call center operators, and clinicians.RESPONSIBILITIES: The consultant will work with DOHMH staff to properly capture issues and assist with resolution. The Team


Our Government & Public Sector Systems Engineering team delivers large-scale software applications and integrated systems, and assists clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. Are you an experienced commercial or open source database platform specialist? Are you an Oracle or SQL Server Platform Specialist? Have you worked on Open source Database platforms like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB or Casandra? Have you migrated Applications from one Database Engine to another? Do you like to engage with senior leadership and determine ways to optimize the IT Platforms & Infrastructure? Do you like to solve the most complex and high scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new platform technologies? Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help organizations understand and use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster, at lower cost?

You will collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements and will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects in order to migrate customer environments to AWS cloud based database platforms.

Our professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as high volume mission critical OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, designing and deploying future state petabyte-scale data warehouse service and building and/or designing reference configurations to enable our customers and influence AWS RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB and Redshift adoption.

You will:

Employ customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, standard methodologies, project management and risk mitigation
Work closely with AWS Platform Service Engineering and Architecture teams to help ensure the success of project consulting engagements with customer
Work directly with customers’ technical resources to devise and recommend solutions based on the understood requirements
Think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Analyze on-premises database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB.
Work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS. This may include, but is not limited to Re-Host database platform on AWS, Upgrade/Optimize for AWS, Re-Factor to open source database platform on AWS
Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance
Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems

Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants will be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, this is a customer-facing role in a hybrid delivery model. Project engagements include remote delivery methods and onsite engagement that will include travel to customer locations as needed.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Experience with C-Level/Director level customers in IT/Business to craft their Enterprise Architecture and IT Strategies
Relevant Application/Database replatforming experience (Commercial to Open Source Engines)
Knowledge of replication technologies such as Oracle GoldenGate, Amazon Database Migration Service, or similar
Experience with mission critical databases across multiple database platforms
Experience in Data Modelling, ETL/ELT workflow management desired & ability to write, tune SQL queries desired
Experience in writing procedural language artifacts: PL/SQL, T-SQL, PL/pgSQL, stored procedures
Experience in AWS Platforms and Service
Experience with Custom/COTS Applications and their implementation/maintenance is highly desired
Experience with TCP/IP Networking
Experience with MS Office (Excel)
Understanding and ability to participate in all phases of the SDLC including requirements gathering, business analysis, configuration management and quality control desired
